review.title: “Has potential to be better”
review.pros: Pros – the company's focus on innovation and technology are commendable.
review.cons: Cons – opportunities for moving up with in the company are obscure/non-existent. could improve in employee work life balance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – investing in your employees current success at Etrade should be enhanced by offering on going training workshops and engagement between management and employee.

review.title: “Financial Service Rep”
review.pros: Pros – Everthing abou them is great
review.cons: Cons – Nothing that I have noticed
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Had the BEST co-workers but the WORST management!”
review.pros: Pros – E*TRADE was a wonderful place to work because of the people that you get to work with each day. Some of the best in the business and you can learn a lot in the short time you will likely stay.
review.cons: Cons – Upper management is the worst as they have no idea what really goes on day to day to keep the customers happy. They have the worst methods of internal promotion and some of the highest turnover I have ever seen because almost every job there is a dead end.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Less management (upper and senior) and more internal promotion.

review.title: “Invaluable experience below market pay”
review.pros: Pros – There are many learning opportunities and you have the ability to obtain various securities licenses.
review.cons: Cons – As an analyst, pay is below market rates.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Compensate employees better to retain talent.

review.title: “Challenging and rewarding, even during stressful time”
review.pros: Pros – Management, at the time, my teammates were the BEST, and support for employees was great.
review.cons: Cons – Went thru 4 mergers in less than 7 years. Having to lay off great people was emotional and then had to hire staff within 3 to 4 months. Very senior management was unapproachable and not receptive to suggestions from any level beneath them.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look at the cons and work on them in the future. Some associates, NOT ON YOUR LEVEL, have ideas that could work. Try being an UNDERCOVER BOSS and sit on the jobs that you are making decisions on WITHOUT truly knowing the process. You might learn a lot....

review.title: “E*TRADE promotes a great team atmosphere!”
review.pros: Pros – Team atmosphere, OT opportunities, Growth potential, CEO is focused on Customer Service first.
review.cons: Cons – Some areas of the processing systems seem more difficult to our clients than it should be.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to promote growth in careers.

review.title: “Lots of opportunity”
review.pros: Pros – Room to move up and to other locations
review.cons: Cons – Great for entry level candidates
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Learned a lot, but hated working here”
review.pros: Pros – Got licensed, learned a lot about numerous financial instruments and how they function.
review.cons: Cons – Training for 7/63 was great, but after that they just kinda throw you in the deep end on the phones. Really would have benefited from some on the job training, but even their 'incubator' wasn't really training. Maybe our group of hires was too big for them to properly train everyone on systems. This job is basically a phone sales position. So much stress is put on getting leads for their financial consultants. Etrade's platforms (for their customers) are so easy to use, which meant someone only called in when something was wrong, or the customers were not smart enough to figure out how to navigate a website. This caused for very stressful/uncomfortable conversations. One of the happiest days of my life was the day I quit working here.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Not a terribly bad place to work at”
review.pros: Pros – They have streamlined internal standards and processes for application software development.
review.cons: Cons – Extremely high workload; Limited opportunities if you'd like to stay abreast on the latest tools. Poor work-life balance.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Decent Customer Service Job”
review.pros: Pros – Decent benefits, pay, and training. At 5:00, you can leave and forget about your job (in a good way).
review.cons: Cons – Aside from "licensed stockbroker" sounding important, just another customer service job in a call center.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I realize a call center job is a call center job, but there's no reason why management couldn't treat it like more than that. In general, FSRs are relatively well educated, and management could treat them more like professionals than like mere phone jockeys.

review.title: “Financial Services Rep”
review.pros: Pros – Good suite of products and services for entry and mid level investors.
review.cons: Cons – Back office operations completes work on their own timeline with no communications. No coaching from management - only directives. Senior Leadership not approachable. No clear direction for the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Develop a strategic direction for the company, then develop a matching pay plan and coach your way to success.

review.title: “Worst People Ever!”
review.pros: Pros – You can steal from people (if you are into that) Well, really you are forced into it, so if you work CSR for etrade you are going to be lying to customers frequently.
review.cons: Cons – You are forced to steal from people. If you speak fluent english you are going to have a hard time finding someone to talk with or making friends.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop stealing from people. You are all crooks and thieves! Give some help when employees ask for it! Stop focusing on stealing from customers and focus on customer service!

review.title: “IF YOU GET HIRED AS AN ASSOCIATE FSR, PASS YOUR EXAMS AND GET OUT AS SOON AS YOU CAN!”
review.pros: Pros – Licensing. Period. It's "free", and they pay you while you are in training. As the title says, get hired as an Associate FSR. It's great coming out of college, or wanting to start a career in finance. START being the keyword.Paul Idzik is great! Structure, streamline, may trickle down. But I doubt it.
review.cons: Cons – If you have morals, do not attempt to work there. If you are creative and know how to motivate, do not fill out an application. If you have potential to be great, you will intimidate your superiors and your Life @ E*TRADE will become a living hell. And if you aren't broken, imagine some place worse than hell.HR is a joke.FSRs and Sr. FSRs are licensed stockbrokers and all we do is sit there and pray that we can meet our quota each week by bringing in money for lazy Financial Consultants who don't do anything but wait for us to put in a lead. We do 75% of the selling and don't get any compensation for it. Bring in 20+ million a quarter and hand the phone off to an un-enthused FC--absolutely no compensation.FSRs and Sr. FSRs who have been working there for 2 years or less know more than managers and senior managers who have been working there for at least decade or more. It does not mix to be a pleasant experience.It's sad when you are told that you have to stifle your innovation and knowledge so not to outshine your aloof and incompetent current manager and future manager to keep your job and to climb the political career ladder at E*TRADE because the dumber you are the more valuable you are to management. Middle management from Senior Managers to Directors aren't creative enough nor know what the FSRs and Sr. FSRs actually go through in order to make processes better. Customer Service Senior Managers do not value the FSRs nor Sr. FSRs. We stayed tethered to a phone and computer screen for 8,10-15 hours a day (sometimes more because of understaffing) but they are quick to forget they made us STOCK BROKERS. They promote who they control instead of promoting people who can actually contribute to our new CEOs vision.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – When you see talent, don't stifle it and don't discourage it, and definitely don't steal it. Bolster it. Have a backbone. Be that one to step up and show upper level management who you've heard about or who you have on your team. Realize that you have people who hold titles lower than yours who are studying competitors in school and know how to implement processes for cheaper.For Senior Management in LOBs other than CS: Know that you are dealing with people who are a decade or more younger than you and can learn what you require in that internal job posting quicker than you could yourself and more quickly than you can find an external hire, if given the opportunity because they want the chance. Don't brush them to the side.Appreciate your minions, they can contribute and can bring your stock options from being underwater.

review.title: “Analyst”
review.pros: Pros – Progressive. They are always looking forward and into the future with their products. They are highly competitive in the market.
review.cons: Cons – Tons of red tape and management issues. It's hard to move up or cross train. Many people stay in the same position for years.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Value you employees

review.title: “Great Place to get started”
review.pros: Pros – This is a great place to get your 7 and 63, heck even more. paid training for 7 & 63 can't be beat. Plenty of overtime if you need extra cash. Overall i learned so much coming out of college and there aren't many opportunities in this area of finance in Atlanta at the moment.
review.cons: Cons – Compensation for lead generation can be boosted.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “good product company to work in”
review.pros: Pros – Process drivenTechnologically in the forefrontWork life balance
review.cons: Cons – Education and rich experience is sometimes underweighedNot sure why some folks not with rich experience and education are in the higher level
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Looking for job at E*trade?”
review.pros: Pros – The company uses cutting edge and open source technologies.Company provides good work environment and focus on framework based development approach to improve productivity.
review.cons: Cons – The company growth does not seem to be impressive for some time and seems to be in the process of changing that by reorganizing and focusing again.Not sure how long it would take to get back into high growth mode.

review.title: “Unlimited comp for sales on the FC side”
review.pros: Pros – Unlimited comp for sales on the FC side I love it it makes me very motivated to work hard.I am happy my manager gives me the space to sell to the right clients. The clients that want and need advice. Many need advice but just do not want it so you need to sift thru to find someone that "gets" that putting all their money in a 12 cent gold mining stock will most likely not help them reach retirement with a good size nest egg.Given 200mm book to work with huge opportunity but can hurt you.A get the job done culture!
review.cons: Cons – *Operations and TOA are way understaffed should have 30-50 people full time. E*TRADE could bring in an additional 10-25% or more in assets and retention if they refined this area in particular.* There should be a positive small revenue share on your practice/book that exceeds threshold or* Threshold feels more like a "steal take"*UMA needs a bond manager yesterday.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look at how other discounters execute operations and TOA then copy what they do well.I am not sure is Paul is wanting to grow us or sell us? I prefer grow there is an enormous opportunity to grab more market share from TD and Schwab.

review.title: “Etrade death”
review.pros: Pros – Mirror test hire meaning if you can fog a mirror with your breath you're hired from what I observe of uneducated simple people in Sandy, UT
review.cons: Cons – Truly mean and manipulative staff who leave you to customers with limited training. After working with larger brokerages it is mesmerizing to see how gullible management is to the slightest concerns. Run... Don't walk from this seeming opportunity.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get some life experience.

review.title: “Stuck behind the pack”
review.pros: Pros – Work culture is generally pretty laid back - very dependant on your branch manager.There is a lot of "low hanging fruit" b/c ETRADE customers are not accustomed to having a FC, if you position yourself properly you can gain a lot of credibility with clients.
review.cons: Cons – Equivalent to horse and buggy in terms of investment and sales capability - lack fixed income options in UMA, no to hardly any I shares, not able to speak to ETF's to client's. Your ability to talk to clients is limited to as if you have no licenses or experience with investments. Company does not value experience, accredations or investment knowledge of FC's.While the comp plan is supposedly "open ended", your threshold is subject to where your branch is located, with better locations having to produce WAY more. Unfortunately they don't do the same distinguishment with base salary, so your base is the same no matter what location you are in... still can't figure this out, but it makes meeting your day to day bills very difficult if you live in a good location. Also you are paid out a full 2 months after the end of the quarter making cash flow managment very difficult. If you miss a bonus you won't be paid for a full 6 months, base is not enough to support you through this time.No addtional benefits to speak of - 2.5% match on 401(k) employee contribution of 5%, NO stock purchase plan (despite being one of the largest ESPP providers), very little to no reimbursement of educational or accrediations, no reason to stay long term leading to high levels of attrition.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior Management that was all recently replaced - what are you doing? Communicate with us, give us some hope, inspire us, right now it's so silent it makes us wonder what in the world is going on.

review.title: “Young and dynamic company with endless opportunities for the brave and ambitious”
review.pros: Pros – Many opportunites to grow whithin. One can start at the bottom and with hard work and the right attitude can easily move up to more rewarding positions.
review.cons: Cons – Compensation could be better. This industry requires talented people to innovate and stay ahead of the curve. Pay seems lower compared to other companies
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep the culture as it is and design fairer compensation package throughout the organization. Identify key personnel that keeps the business running and the compensate them based on merit.

review.title: “Good Company but needs improvement in several areas”
review.pros: Pros – Hardworking staff, dedicated workforce, Get it done attitude among employees is the backbone of E*TRADE's technology domain. The business and technology teams work hand in hand to deliver award winning products
review.cons: Cons – No work/life balance in this company. Promotions and raises are tough to come by regardless the amount of quality time and effort you put in your job or deliver outstanding results.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work towards employee retention and creating a better work environment for your employees. Acknowledge the hard work and dedication of your employees by appropriately compensating them for their hard work and result oriented work

review.title: “Software Engineer”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly environment, lots of personal time.
review.cons: Cons – Not too much room for career development
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Good Employer”
review.pros: Pros – Great Culture, Was able to advance but it took a year and a half
review.cons: Cons – uncertain future, new management team
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “A pretty good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Pays decent, mostly flexible, an overall pretty good place to work. Not necessarily a lifetime opportunity, but definitely a great place to lead to better opportunities.
review.cons: Cons – Management is full of real 'jerk' type of personalities. They almost seem to reward the 'barker screamer' type over actual competence. Which leads to many departments being run by barking idiots over actual competent people. If you have any real talent, most likely, you won't stay here long-term. A good place as a launching pad for talented people, then take your talents to a better place.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “I had an amazing tenure at E*TRADE. Lots of opportunities to work with amazing people and projects.”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible work schedule, and depending on your team, the opportunity to work on good, visible projects.
review.cons: Cons – Constantly changing. They had more than 6 CEO's and numerous changes in their "vision" and management. If you can't weather the storm and you're not aligned with the right people, your screwed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get your act together. E*TRADE has the roots to make a great company but the revolving door of CEO's and upper management are the company's own enemy.

review.title: “its a bumpy ride”
review.pros: Pros – Good environment, good work life balance, good locations, good benefits... All in all its a good place to stay for a small duration
review.cons: Cons – There is no vision and no planning... things keep changing every now and then and keep loosing focus
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Not so extraordinary!”
review.pros: Pros – 1) Good place to pick up your security licenses and learn about the stock market, financial services, and obtain some customer service call center experience.2) Promotions are based on the buddy system rather than skills and abilities. Backstabbing is encouraged and rewarded, so if you are good at kissing up to management, good at beating down your coworkers and covering your backside, this is a great to work!
review.cons: Cons – 1) Company too cheap to hire enough employees to cover the daily call volume and too cheap to provide smooth operating computer systems for optimum job performance.2) Customer Service employees are micro-managed to the max through a Command Center, customer service management uses negative reinforcement rather than positive reinforcement to motivate employees resulting in low morale and high turnover.3) Most feedback from customer service managers is "not provided" in a timely manner resulting in minor problems/infractions becoming more numerous and more serious than they need to be.4) Customer service work procedures and expectations are constantly changing or flip-flopping back and forth without notice or warning ... what was okay yesterday, may not be okay today, but could be okay again to tomorrow (very confusing & contradictory).5) New employees and/or employees filling new positions are not supported or provided with sufficient customer service training to get their jobs done without a lot of hand holding.6) Objective employee feedback and constructive criticism regarding work processes and/or management style is frowned upon. Honesty and being outspoken is not a plus or conducive to job security.7) Employees who fail to find a place in the buddy system are setup for failure and termination.8) Older employees on the higher end of the pay scale with mucho vacation days are driven off or put out to pasture, while younger employees with less pay, less vacation days, and less experience are retained.9) Appears to be a lot of age biasness and religious biasness in the hiring process, promotion process and in employee retention process.10) Company struggling to find and hold on to a stable CEO and survive their subprime problems. Not a stable work environment for anyone looking for fair treatment and job security.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – 1) Take some courses in management and human relations.2) Start treating your employees with the dignity and the respect they deserve.3) Stop harboring ill-will over all the little things (keep your egos in check) and provide your employees with more positive feedback and a well deserved pat on the back.

review.title: “An honest assessment of E*TRADE...”
review.pros: Pros – Work/life balance, some of the products
review.cons: Cons – Pay, ESPP (or lack thereof), the people (can you say "C"-team?), management (old regime that is), culture, environment
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Although most of the culprits have seemingly been flushed out, there are a few very, very unqualified Director's and VP's. Plus, too many good people have been lost lately because the ineffective placed blame at the bottom.. until it trickled back up that is. Kudos to the new CEO for recognizing...

review.title: “Unskilled, uncaring management”
review.pros: Pros – No micro-management in some locations...a problem in others
review.cons: Cons – Uncaring, unskilled, self serving management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Begin thinking of employees as other than a necessary evil

review.title: “It was a great experience working in Financial domain”
review.pros: Pros – It was good to learn and have working in Financial domain
review.cons: Cons – Constant changing of management has lost so many talented resources
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great Company to work for”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to gain experience and knowledge
review.cons: Cons – No work/life balance, Not much room for growth depending on the department, classic Corporate America,
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need more flexibility for employees

review.title: “Overall good, but not the greatest”
review.pros: Pros – Good work life balance and overall flexible hours
review.cons: Cons – Lack of good management; lack of direction
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get back on track; have a solid business strategy

review.title: “It was a circus.”
review.pros: Pros – Good people with good intentions and resilience in the face of futility.
review.cons: Cons – Disorganized, backward project development process and poorly managed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Support your personnel, don't bully them.

review.title: “Overall a good company to learn about financial service industry”
review.pros: Pros – People are smart, supportive and dedicated to their work; culture, always try to excel, innovate and fast paced; in both banking and brokerage business, and not too big/bureaucratic
review.cons: Cons – Too many upper management turnarounds in recent years
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Figure out a strategy and find the right people and stick with them

review.title: “Great place to learn about the financial services/brokerage business”
review.pros: Pros – Pay you to get your Series 7 and Series 63 license, benefits are very good, starting pay is decent. Learn a good deal about the financial world in a short amount of time, very applicable if you move to another financial job. All my managers but one were great people to work with, and always there to help. You get a 10% pay increase for working any hours past 5 pm, and any time on the weekends. Business casual dress.
review.cons: Cons – You are monitored on everything you do, from taking exactly a 15 min break, to "unscheduled" bathroom breaks. You phone and computer are tied together and you must "code" you phone to what you are doing, so they now what you are doing all the time. Job can get very monotonous and repetitive. Can be easy to get burnt out. E*trade is open 24/7, so you if you get stuck on the night shift, it can be a while before you get back to regular hours. You have to try to get "leads" for the company (7-10 a week) and you don't get any additional pay for going the extra mile and getting them.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ease up on the 24/7 monitoring, would be nice to get a little compensation for leads.

review.title: “Mean, Rude, Arrogant and Obnoxious Culture”
review.pros: Pros – Salary and benefits aren't bad. The staff is great! The company seems to be getting its act together from a profitability point of view.
review.cons: Cons – Most managers from director on up to senior management are some of the meanest people I have worked with anywhere. Extreme micro-management combined with arrogant, unappreciative managers has lead to low morale and some turnover. In spite of decent salaries, the raises are quite terrible. Senior management does not seem to have any vision for the future which makes for further complacency.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's quite clear that management has given up. There is no vision and no innovation. Instead of pretending that the company has a future, just admit that the company is just doing enough to sell.

review.title: “Operations analyst”
review.pros: Pros – National corp discounts, relaxed dress code, work from home, approves expense reports quickly, out of the office outings were great. Very flexible on taking vacations during the year.
review.cons: Cons – Upper management does not listen, no advancement, long hours, HR dept is caught in between. Addressed internal issues to HR and they finally address them after 6 months...that's way too long! I was promised a review after 60 days and it didn't take place until I pushed it and by that time to was 6 months.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to your employees concerns...more people would stick around

review.title: “E*trade is good or bad.. it all depends who you worked for in the company”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible work hours but not the same for all employees.
review.cons: Cons – Salary and no room for growth even if you work there for years and your responsibilities increase they refuse to pay you as you deserve to.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You need to consider all employees and not only the brown noses. in the credit administration department it's noticed that in order to grow you have to be part of the click and if you are not or have had differences with one of the "star" managers you can kiss goodbye to growth.. promotion, good bonuses, and raises. Management in that department needs to be reviewed. Just my thought....

review.title: “Lots of changes”
review.pros: Pros – Good pay and benefits, work and life balance is fantastic.
review.cons: Cons – No loyalty to employees, they will use and lose you. Company politics drive or stifle programs depending on who your buddies are.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You must communicate to your teams, make them feel valued.

review.title: “Good Culture, executive team made work life hard”
review.pros: Pros – Hard working, proud employees. Underdog mentality led to trying to achieve a greater good for the company. Benefits were competitive.
review.cons: Cons – Executive team turnover. Bad balance sheet management effected everybody. Young sales organization did not have the resources or training to effectively manage sales force.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great culture and work life balance”
review.pros: Pros – Laid back and low pressure environment. Management very accommodating of adjusting work schedules and time off. Adjustable work schedules as long as you put in 8 hours and get work done. Pay is OK taking into consideration nature of work. Management really looks out for employees. Co-workers were all very friendly and approachable. Collegial work atmosphere among different departments.
review.cons: Cons – Work can be routine and unexciting. Layoffs can be rampant especially in Operations. Can get stuck in mediocre position for long time with little pay increases and not much advancement opportunities due to business climates. Low turnover and staff cutbacks which reduces growth opportunities.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Stable company? No more”
review.pros: Pros – - Good work/life balance- Friendly colleages
review.cons: Cons – - Management generally lacks management skills, fail to inspire employees. Middle managers have not changed for 10 years so no opportunities for other to advance.- Good people finally start leaving after recent massive layoff. Moral has been low for a long time.- Too much processes
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Value human asset. Don't view them as disposable resources.

review.title: “Run from this place. The culture will eat your soul.”
review.pros: Pros – OK benefits, nothing special. Cafeteria in building. Nice location in midtown. Company sounds cool on a resume.
review.cons: Cons – Never experienced such a hostile work environment in all of my career. Culture of every man for himself and zero accountability. Peter Principle in full effect here. Majority of employees find themselves in the middle of the "blame game", having to constantly defend themselves from verbally abusive coworkers. Some of these known repeat offenders are completely out of control. HR mentality seems to encourage this behavior. People with real skill and talent will never be rewarded at this company. Morale is low, heads are down, and people avoid eye contact. Stress is high, tension is thick, and good people jump ship at the first opportunity.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Longevity does not equate to capability. The whole of the executive suite is a nightmare to deal with- from the laughably incompetent secretaries to the disconnected executives who clearly only care about their paychecks. This trickle down effect sets the tone for the rest of the office, and is unfortunately making the company a very unpleasant place to work.

review.title: “it's ok overall in all the area.”
review.pros: Pros – Good people with the ok pay.
review.cons: Cons – for the management keep changing

review.title: “What a Joke, avoid this company at all costs!”
review.pros: Pros – decent pay and benefits for the jobvacation starts to accrue from the first day
review.cons: Cons – everything about the jobyou're not a broker you are a customer service repyou will never work for a more micromanaged company in your life, guaranteed!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – what management?

review.title: “E*Trade Manila call center”
review.pros: Pros – strong emphasis on technology, latest trading technologies, advanced trading platform, global trading.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of accountability and disconnectedness of operations in Manilla. Inability to contact operations directly to jointly resolve escalated problems. Strong emphasis on cost savings through brokers in Manilla who frequently misunderstand words in English. Clients only get to speak with Americans once they become frustrated with Manilla reps.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat employees with more respect. Randomly demanding mandatory overtime on weekends or other inconvenient times puts demands on employees that are worth more than just being paid overtime pay. Trying to motivate employees to do more work for free by calling work a "game" insults employee intelligence as employees are there to make a living and do not work to play games. More incentives are needed for additional work requirements as this is not a cost savings strategy.

review.title: “It is a "hot mess" right now - avoid.”
review.pros: Pros – Reasonable hours, lack of any deadlines. New CEO is at least trying to break through the walls that protect those who refuse to embrace change and prevent innovation.
review.cons: Cons – Entire senior management group has left (note this could be seen as a pro, but it remains to be seen.) Remaining managers have dug in like the battle of the Somme. Very little chance to grow or learn new technologies. Most good employees have left and those that remain are shell-shocked.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep on pushing change. It may have to go all the way to the lowest levels of management before the job is done. Bring in new blood at all levels of management.

review.title: “Since I've started things have gone down hill. First there were few development projects. Now there are hardly any,”
review.pros: Pros – -nice team members to work with-good compensation
review.cons: Cons – -no flexible work hours-no work from home-cube walls are short-director and VP are inconsiderate-no good projects are coming-I am not being used to my full potential
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Motivate your employees to want to be here by giving interesting projects and flexible work hours.

review.title: “Decent Place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Good Benefits, Great People, Decent Compensation
review.cons: Cons – Technology side of the organization is declining

review.title: “Senior developer”
review.pros: Pros – Good work /life balance, decent salaries and bonus, good team and nice place to work.Latest technologies to learn and grow.
review.cons: Cons – sometimes requires 24/7 support.no more work from home allowed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please improve perfomance review system.

review.title: “You need the right position”
review.pros: Pros – There are some advancement opportunities. The pay is competitive but will likely be on the lower than average range.
review.cons: Cons – If you're stuck in the wrong position (customer service), you will hate life. If that's you, apply to any/all openings you qualify for and hope that some hiring manager saves you. Otherwise, it'll wreck your psyche.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ease up on the csr. The job is hell and you're not exactly paying a premium to attract the best talent.

review.title: “Great learning experience to help the next company”
review.pros: Pros – Great people to work with
review.cons: Cons – Management has everyone a bit confused.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – People really do want to exceed here. You need to let them.

review.title: “senior software engineer”
review.pros: Pros – Goood balance of work and personal life.
review.cons: Cons – Very bad compensation. 20% below market average.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A company in turmoil”
review.pros: Pros – Salary is competitive, good benefits package
review.cons: Cons – With the new CEO, the company is in a huge state of flux. Multiple top level executives were given their walking papers and serious reorg is in the works. They are still digging themselves out of a huge sinkhole due to the loan crisis and are expected to cut 100 million dollars in expenses this year.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – GET IT TOGETHER or SELL

review.title: “Satisfied employee but company is not growing”
review.pros: Pros – rewards top producing employees, lots of time off for employees been there for 5+ years
review.cons: Cons – limited growth potential for someone with an MBA who is not willing to move
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great place to start...”
review.pros: Pros – Very flexible and don't expect muchWilling to train and educate
review.cons: Cons – No upward mobilityVery top heavy
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you paid a bit more you'd attract better talent

review.title: “Good first job”
review.pros: Pros – Etrade will train you to get your Series 7 brokers license. If you are not opposed to moving around there is some ooportunity for advancement. The company is small and earning potential is limited. It is good company to get some experience and go somewhere else to use it.
review.cons: Cons – No real up earning potential because of company size and corporate structure. Company is top heavy with management and is not taken seriously by serious investors. You always get the feeling the company is about to sold or is on the market for a buyer.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make up you mind what you want to be, either an investment firm providing solid investment advice or a cheap gimmicky discount broker.
review.recommended: – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “A review of ETade Financial Corporation”
review.pros: Pros – Its a great enviornment to work in. Finance company with a internet attitude. Started as a temp and quickly became a permanent employee.
review.cons: Cons – Company is not making it marks. It seems as if everyday someone else has been let go.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Needs the right people to make this place right”
review.pros: Pros – can't find any pros here
review.cons: Cons – Advancement only is you know someone
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Mid management is clueless

review.title: “E*TRADE Financial”
review.pros: Pros – Great Culture. New CEO. Great Brand.
review.cons: Cons – Cleaning up the bank side balance sheet
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Too much Politics”
review.pros: Pros – Can get to know about Finance - Stocks, Trading
review.cons: Cons – Horrible Asian work culture, politics, stressful work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Managers need management skill as well as technical skill.

review.title: “Relationship Manager”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to get some experience and then move on. People are generally nice to work with.
review.cons: Cons – Systems systems systems. For a company that prides itself on technology ETrade has more system issues than any company I've ever seen. Embarassing plain and simple.Some managers are severly unqualified and lack graduate degrees. Promotions are based on friendship and not merit in many departments. Professionalism is not exactly the strong suit.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get a clue

review.title: “Company in maintainence mode”
review.pros: Pros – - Relaxed work environment- Good work life balance- No hectic schedules
review.cons: Cons – - No new products- Maintenance of existing products- Least recognition for good work done- Benefits are ok- Green Card processing is very slow and bad (nothing more can be expected since the company is in cost cutting mode)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - New products and new idea should be brought in.

review.title: “Get a start here, but don't get too comfortable.”
review.pros: Pros – Good place for a young person starting out in the securities industry to get licensed and learn a few things. They pay for your licensing. You don't really have to take your work home with you.
review.cons: Cons – Low pay. It's a call center. Low employee morale. Every second of your day is micromanaged. Rude customers. Promotions are actually just lateral moves to other departments doing the same thing. Company touts promoting from within but sought after positions are filled outside.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – De-emphasize the "CE" requirement. Many excellent reps do not receive the recognition they should because they choose to not abuse the referral system like other reps. Being able to "put on over" on management with inflated referral leads shouldn't be rewarded. Top referral performers are the least likely to allow others to observe their habits for a reason.

review.title: “Good Experience in short-term but dead end road”
review.pros: Pros – Makes it easy to get acclimated with the market and a range of investments. Benefits are great. Good place to get a series 7 as they have a good training program but most moves within the company after that are lateral.
review.cons: Cons – Very micro managed. Because of this, it is difficult to create relationships within the workplace. Most employees show up and leave with very little interaction. It is luck of the draw to get off work and most people end up taking PTO days in the middle of the week because Mondays and Fridays are the busiest days. New hires typically are stuck on an off hour shift that may include nights and weekends.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep a CEO longer than 6 months that can implement a strategy to be more successful.

review.title: “Corporate Services is a short-term job”
review.pros: Pros – Fine place to spend 3-4 years but not a place for a long-term career. Good experience in corporate services to take to another company. Great experience in equity compensation but usually you must move away from Atlanta to find another job in the equity comp field.
review.cons: Cons – Management won't developing employees, management always hires from the outside, raises are not regular but come every 3-4 years. Client services is overworked, client management is underworked and overpaid, and product management is underappreciated which results in incredibly high turnover.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop the regular cycle of building up and pulling back.

review.title: “Not a bad place to work if you're in the IT department”
review.pros: Pros – Good life work balance; sane work hours and the company management does a nice job of providing team-building events and fosters an overall sense of good spirit.
review.cons: Cons – Working with other teams can be difficult; not the most challenging job I've had in my career.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Break through some of the silos and get teams to communicate and work together more cooperatively. Challenge the status quo and don't just settle for "business as usual."

review.title: “Great Benets but Horrible Job”
review.pros: Pros – Great benefits and work life balance
review.cons: Cons – Call center environment, everyone hates their job.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make an effort to improve the work environment and employee morale. Please telling employees how poorly the company is doing to scare them into working harder.

review.title: “Everyone is an island, little opportunity to grow”
review.pros: Pros – They hand out titles like lollipops and E*TRADE looks good on a resume.
review.cons: Cons – They hook you in the position with a higher than normal salary and promises of bonsuses, raises and promotions. Opinion throughout the company is that these are never delivered on. Good jobs go to outside hires. Very poorly managed from senior managers on up. Extreme micro management. Policies within the company don't communicate to each other.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Back off. Let your employees do what they were hired for without constant check ins.

review.title: “Everyone is an island, little opportunity to grow”
review.pros: Pros – They hand out titles like lollipops and E*TRADE looks good on a resume.
review.cons: Cons – They hook you in the position with a higher than normal salary and promises of bonsuses, raises and promotions. Opinion throughout the company is that these are never delivered on. Good jobs go to outside hires. Very poorly managed from senior managers on up. Extreme micro management. Policies within the company don't communicate to each other.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Back off. Let your employees do what they were hired for without constant check ins.

review.title: “Senior program manager”
review.pros: Pros – Good tech team to work with
review.cons: Cons – Poor management team, not much career growth

review.title: “Not place to build your career”
review.pros: Pros – Work colleagues keep day fun
review.cons: Cons – Management makes salaries on performance of reps. Since products are sub par management continues to squeeze blood from stones which makes job difficult
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Call Center Environment--Micromanagement to the Extreme”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits are decent. You get paid time and a half for overtime because everyone except managers are hourly. It's a good place to get licensed and start out, but not a good place for a career.
review.cons: Cons – Wow, where do I start? Very hard to get time off. Micromangement at its finest. Pay is not great for the industry. There is not much upward movement--only lateral movement. They say there are tons of ways you can go but there's not, just different teams within customer service and a call center.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Financial Services Representative”
review.pros: Pros – Physical location is close to the freeway. The doors are open when you get to work. Most of the managers could fog up a mirror.
review.cons: Cons – In four years time, my hourly pay has increased about 7%. My health insurance costs for identical coverage has increased by over 36%! I actually take home less now than when I started because Etrade now takes so much more out of my check for health insurance. At the same time the fomer CEO Steve Frieburg saw his base pay go form 1 million to over 3 million the second year. The managers were all managers with companies that Etrade bougtht before the collaterized mortgage fiasco. Only 1 manager is actually a manager due to a promotion . 4 of our managers, including a top level executive, came to Etrade from Fidelity because they got laid off at Fidelity. Etrade was NOT their first choice for employment and it shows. Management FORBIDS any direct communication with the CEO. It is MANDATORY that ALL employee to CEO communicaiton be perused by immedate management first. Etrade stock has never been valued at more that 1/2 of what TD Ameritrade trades for. After working at Etrade it is easy to see why. This company could spoil an erotic dream!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Tread your employees like the valuable resources they are. Do not assume that a 75% turnover rate every four years is normal! Train your managers to motivate and not terrorize!

review.title: “Arlington, VA”
review.pros: Pros – Interesting work and manageable hours
review.cons: Cons – Flexible work arrangements are not available. Very odd for such a new company with their store front on the web! Face time is everything. Working Mothers beware!401k match is very low compared to any other companies I have worked for. The company tries to save costs by outsourcing functions to India and constantly looks for more jobs to export. They’re very proud of the success of this which is sad because we should keep as many positions in the US as possible. I’m embarrassed by this practice. Very little opportunity for growth and they actually demote people – who does that? Some managers have constant turn over and instead of fixing the problem they continue to just hire new staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Many of those have been with the company over 10 years which is a HUGE issue. Very much an old boys club attitude since they have been here so long. It would be better to get some fresh talent with innovative ideas who put employees first instead of the bottom line. Let each group decide how they should be structured and their workload instead of micro managing everything – manage the big picture!

review.title: “Review of E TRADE FInancial”
review.pros: Pros – *During my time, benefits such as health insurance, vision, and dental were good.*Ability to learn markets
review.cons: Cons – *If you begin on the telephone, difficult to transition to a different sector of company*Raises non existent during my time there.*Salaries weren't the greatest

review.title: “Don't waste your time”
review.pros: Pros – Can't think of any... Good location.
review.cons: Cons – Ineffective leadership from Senior level down to the sales manager. This company has no sales leadership from what I can see. My experience was the managers I interacted with were constantly in CYA mode. No one inspires anyone here with few exceptions. Sales meetings are a combination of information dump and beat downs. Training is 'one and done'. Individual goals do not match overall corporate messaging and direction. My manager regularly sent chastising e-mails - singling one employee out to the entire team. My sales manager would single out people in ALL CAPS TO EVERYONE. Hellooo.. HR, are you reading this??
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire sales leaders versus sales managers. Inspire your teams to greatness - not beat downs. Stop telling your teams 'what'; start showing them 'how'. (I suspect that most sales managers are clueless about the how component). Have your sales managers share a good idea to help Consultants succeed. This place is mostly void of solid talent.

review.title: “It has been a decent company to work for”
review.pros: Pros – The best reasons to work for E*TRADE for me are benefits the compensation could be better. I feel the medical and dental insurances are superior. There are also other benefits such as 5% 401k matching and tuition reimbursement
review.cons: Cons – The downside is the micro management on the lower service teams. It is more of a political game when it comes to promotion. Several individuals come to this company with years of experience and I feel they are belittled to fit the call center mode.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Really show your appreciation through the bonuses.

review.title: “Overall it's a good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Good team and there's a ton of knowledge to be learned.
review.cons: Cons – Non-traditional hours, work/life balance can be difficult, work may become repetitive and dull
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “DBA at etrade”
review.pros: Pros – Good Company, nice place to work
review.cons: Cons – Nothing as of now to say
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great learning experience tech and finance combined”
review.pros: Pros – Technologically advanced and opportunity to learn
review.cons: Cons – Lack of leadership and talent retention
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Overall pretty good”
review.pros: Pros – Good ManagersGood work/life balanceGood base salary and earnings potentialRelaxed work environment
review.cons: Cons – Operational side is still a work in progress, not on the same page with sales. Can be more difficult for customers to open and transfer accounts, compared to larger firms.Commission plan changes often, consultants now get charged back for giving customers promotions, if customer moves from stock to cash, and you will get charged back if clients moves money out, causing wild swings in bonus.I feel like this job has more Pros than Cons compared with other jobs I've had.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Overall I’ve been happy with management, they give you space and offer help when needed. It would be nice if we could get more help with service issues and just focus more of our time on sales.

review.title: “Great environment”
review.pros: Pros – Good team and there's a ton of knowledge to be learned.
review.cons: Cons – Nothing negative about working here.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None

review.title: “Good company to learn experiences in the Brokerage Industry”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefits and the vacation request process is easy to manage. Casual work environment. Expect to wear slacks and shirts. E*TRADE will train & pay for your Series 7 & 63. Good place to learn call-center experiences, brokerage industry experiences, stock-plan, retirements accounts. 6 months to apply for promotion.
review.cons: Cons – Expect to work with non-traditional hours when you first start. Sat & Sun can be your workday. Your manager, depending on who, can be a micromanager. The company will expect you to "sale" leads to Financial Consultants, or Active Trader Consultants, but reward you very little in compensation. Along with compensation, it should be higher. E*TRADE will expect you to do a lot.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Compensate associates more for the works they do.

review.title: “Good place to work, although work/life balance can be a challenge.”
review.pros: Pros – Exciting, dynamic, and challenging place to work. Worked with a lot of smart, intelligent, motivated people. You will be rewarded when taking on additional responsibilities while continuing to perform at a high level.
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balance can be a bit difficult at times. I definitely felt that people who knew how to play the game, but were by no means all-stars, were unfairly rewarded and promoted over smarter, harder working, higher performing employees who were less socially savvy.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Senior Project Management”
review.pros: Pros – The life-work balance is great. Everyone is focused on business while in the office then go home.
review.cons: Cons – Financial services in general isn't a growth industry at the moment so opportunities are limited.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take more risks with current technology and embrace ideas that may not yield big ROI in the near term but can differentiate us from the competition going forward.

review.title: “E*TRADE is a decent place to work, but as with any company has its pros and cons.”
review.pros: Pros – The atmosphere is great, the people are great, generally pretty good to work with. The benefits are second to none.
review.cons: Cons – The commissions bonus program, lacks transparency and tends to leave you wonderig if it is set up to benefit you or the company.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Competitive, but not quite polished”
review.pros: Pros – Strong on trading technology and the range of investment products available to its customers. Seeks to compete in a very competitive environment.
review.cons: Cons – The company is still young and its processes and policies are not complete. Compare to competitor firms, where I've also worked, representative tools and support is highly lacking.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great place to work to learn the industry from the ground up”
review.pros: Pros – Internal Advancement are dependent upon PerformanceKnowledgeable Upper ManagementGreat Company CultureExtremely Flexible with work schedule
review.cons: Cons – Work may become repetitive and dullI cannot complain, things have been great for the past 9 months
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you are currently doing!

review.title: “FSR”
review.pros: Pros – I had very friendly co-workers and managers. The work enviroment is really good. Overall, I would recommend this company to friends looking for a job out of college.
review.cons: Cons – The pay was low and they were constantly thinking of ways to save money. They need to pay a more competitive salary compared to other financial companies.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Good place to start but don't stay long”
review.pros: Pros – -Paid training for series 7/63 license-Decent pay for a recent college grad-Will learn a lot about the industry
review.cons: Cons – This position is extremely micromanaged. They have a computer system that tracks everything you do, down to the second. If you clock in one minute late or stay on a call too long you'll hear about it immediately. The job became extremely stressful do to management constantly on your back about CE (leads). The morale here is very low do to the fact that the job gets very redundant. There is no opportunity for growth. Promotions are viewed as lateral movement so there is little pay increase.

review.title: “If you have no other cohice”
review.pros: Pros – Paid training to get licensedBenefits are pretty good
review.cons: Cons – Just a call center. Managers like to micro manage. No real room for growth just lateral movements. If you really want to move up here you would have to be in it for the long haul and spend five plus years to move up. The monotony of a call center can get to individuals and company doesn't
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Just OK, could be a lot better”
review.pros: Pros – Pay to receive your Series 7 & 63.Employees generally get along well with each other.Benefits are pretty good, especially vision.
review.cons: Cons – Management makes constant changes without notifying the employees that actually do the job or use the systems.Growth potential is no longer as available as it used to be. Moves to other departments are all viewed as lateral so there is little pay increase. Promotions now only come when someone else leaves the company.Most managers can't be trusted and seem to have their own interests at heart always.Pay is low and employee morale is extremely low.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make a better effort to listen to employee suggestions and involve the people who actually use your systems in the decision making process for upgrades and improvements. Your employees make your company move. Find better ways to take care of them and make them feel appreciated because that is a main reason some of the brightest and best employees move on from this company so fast and morale remains so low. Contrary to belief, the customer is NOT always right and should have some sort of accountability for them as well. Many employees have been blamed for difficult customers who have no basis for their attitudes.

review.title: “Great opportunities for advancement, but liquidity issue hamper new strategic initiatives.”
review.pros: Pros – Great opportunities to take on additional responsibilities and learn new functional areas. Prior to 2007 the firm was in many interesting markets outside of the US which provided dynamic roles in IT, Operations and Marketing.
review.cons: Cons – Work life balance is difficult, and employees are often unrewarded for working 60 - 80 hour work weeks when there are challenging situations. Several departments have significantly lower workload than some key areas.

review.title: “Long hours and poor support”
review.pros: Pros – The people I worked with directly were great and care about the company.Communication is getting better.
review.cons: Cons – Good old boys clubShort sighted, need better balance between quarterly profits and long-term goalsPoor management of employee satisfaction
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't just survey employees on satisfaction, hold management accountable for retention and satisfaction goals.

review.title: “Great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – You don't take the job home with you, training is good, people are great, and management is very easy to work with and like able.
review.cons: Cons – You don't make much money.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give employees more ways to increase their pay.

review.title: “Great place for NCAs. Not for middle level people”
review.pros: Pros – Beginners have tons of things to learn. Great technologies are available to explore. All open source at work. Its a great technology company.
review.cons: Cons – The etrade has too many managers and there is no growth potential for this company in the current world. The middle layer of employees are struggling.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Too many rules at work. Not a good idea to have a time based work enviornment at a software concern.

review.title: “I have loved working at Etrade”
review.pros: Pros – There are lots of opportunites for growth at Etrade, and the management is great for helping their employees succeed. Promotions are based on performance, not tenure which I really like.
review.cons: Cons – 401k does not match very much. Health insurance is okay but not the best. Company is not as big as others, so growth is slower than other places.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management at Etrade is great and very helpful. If you are a good employee, they will help you succeed.

review.title: “good place to start, not a lot of room for movement”
review.pros: Pros – benefits, professional culture, good entry-level job
review.cons: Cons – micro-managing, not a lot of room for growth, when you do bad, you know about it. when you do well, you are not rewarded. a lot of 'who you know' politicing.

review.title: “If you want to get licensed, get in and get out”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefits, they have different schedules than the 9-5 so that may appeal to some people. You can get licensed and they train you to pass the test.
review.cons: Cons – My shift changed without my notice. I felt like management lacked respect for employees, which didn't motivate me to want to work there.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Respect the FSRs they are the ones dealing with the customers. If you think you see the same thing over and over again, tell people.

review.title: “Boring, dead-end job”
review.pros: Pros – Overtime available which is nice to make extra money
review.cons: Cons – Zero career path, can't really get higher than manager.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It is what it is

review.title: “My experience at E*TRADE has been rewarding with advancement opportunities in to management and above average benefits.”
review.pros: Pros – Fair pay stucture.Benefits from day one.Pleasant work enviornment
review.cons: Cons – After mid management advancement limited.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be better at coaching and mentoring subordinates

review.title: “It is fine company to work with.”
review.pros: Pros – It is right size company.
review.cons: Cons – Work location is not flexible.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Fair and transparent are needed

review.title: “Educational but going no where”
review.pros: Pros – To get licensed and learn about the securities industry.
review.cons: Cons – Benefits, ok. Opportunities, very limited.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None.

review.title: “Etrade, great people.”
review.pros: Pros – The people are passionate, close knit, and have an immense sense of ownership. The immediate management listens well to the employees.
review.cons: Cons – growth ads bureaucracy. This isn't a fault of the company per say but the reality of SOX. Also due to size, innovation has suffered.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Improve communication with the employee base. Take risks with development, not with revenue. shut up and listen to the middle and lower tiers.

review.title: “The place for a predictable, dead-end, service job.”
review.pros: Pros – Customers are relatively happy versus a big bank. But seriously, the big banks are VERY incompetent so how hard can it be??? Some good technology but poor hardware to back it up. You can pick up some more brokerage licenses vs. a typical bank. They haven't bounced a paycheck yet. Smaller size means the company is more responsive but not responsive enough versus its even smaller, niche rivals. A competent, all-around retail broker.
review.cons: Cons – No room for advancement. No feeling of a future at this place. No feeling of accomplishment. Everyone is replaceable. Development of unique skills and/or strengths is not encouraged. I'm basically here to collect a weak paycheck; nothing more, and that really leaves you feeling like you're wasting your time. Darn, I'm bored! Constant concerns over bankruptcy, takeover, are they gonna shut down my office?, is my job gonna be shipped to Manila?, etc. But seriously, what can you do in this terrible economy??? I've seen some very capable people move on. Shabby offices. Decrepit furniture and 10-year old computers. Most of us gather on the weekend to drink and show-up bleary-eyed on Monday morning to start all over again. Is that really any way to end a week??? Numb the pain. Tax season is the pits and is one of the biggest reasons people quit.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Your employees are bored! You re-hash the same old stuff and claim its new to your customers! They are smarter than that! The baby ads are getting lame. Time for something new. You have no idea of the repressed talent at your fingertips that could be doing so much more. Harness it!

review.title: “Great place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – - Great teamwork within the group.- Excellent manager who watches out for his employees.- Interesting technology and projects.- Great sense of pride in work.- Great benefits and opportunity to grow your career.- Rewards are available for those who work hard and earn it.
review.cons: Cons – - The position is not your typical Security Engineering role. More like Security Tools. Not network heavy like most Security Engineering teams.- Upper level management throws projects around or stalls/squashes projects randomly- Lots of politics on larger "Charged" projects that lead to dead-ends or delay/partial implementation.- No long term security vision from upper management. More plugging the gaps to cover.- No backup engineer for your projects. That means there is no on-call schedule, you are on-call for your stuff always. *I mention this as a con because it's not the norm. I personally like this better than on-call schedules and instills a sense of "eating your own dog food"- Management commonly give Production and development much higher priority than Security. Consistently feel like you there because they could not get rid of you (like life insurance. No one want's to pay it, but they do)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Develop a long term plan for Security at E*TRADE.- Place a higher emphasis on Security with projects and peers.- Highlight the great benefits E*TRADE has. Many employees do not realize how good they are.

review.title: “n/a”
review.pros: Pros – location, schedule, people, experience, benefits
review.cons: Cons – no room for advancement and little time off
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – stop micro managing

review.title: “Stay away from the System Engineering team”
review.pros: Pros – Technology wise, Etrade does try to stay on top of current trend and you will learn quite a bit especially in the open source market.
review.cons: Cons – The biggest issue at Etrade (Menlo) and the reason for so many people leaving the company lately (or about to leave) is the management team. None of the leaders have a clue on how to manage people. They are very driven people with their own agenda and care less about how the people they manage feel. They are borderline unprofessional people with no sympathy for others. They will drive you down until you quit without remorse if they don't like you, and there is nothing HR can do about it because nobody wants to stand up to them. Those so call "leaders" have been with the company for years, have build an awful reputation, and manage based on fear and reprisal. I have to admit that those people are technically competent and should probably be Architects, but definitely not people manager.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “great place to start in the industry”
review.pros: Pros – great place to start in the industry, get your licenses, and get the general process of how a brokerage house works. young management with some experience enables you to learn with them and see errors that you hopefully wont make when you become a manager somewhere else
review.cons: Cons – related to the above issue with young management. Complete lack of mentoring. You are on your own to learn the ropes of the industry. inexperienced and uneducated. Not too many places for advancement once you learn the basis.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – not much as it seems this is a great strategy to keep people that would otherwise not be employed to their current level anywhere else. This creates a high attrition rate in that these managers with no education or experience know this is a good place to stay and from which to retire. CEO is too new to decide how he's doing but so far he's done a good job.

review.title: “Innovative, good tech team”
review.pros: Pros – Great technology. Great place to work if you seek new challenges. Flexibility.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours. Pay not great
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay more. I liked working there but was offered more money outside

review.title: “Great people, great benefits, great work environment, overall a great place to be!”
review.pros: Pros – The people at E*Trade are great, everyone is very professional yet easy to talk to and approachable. Managers have a very good relationship with employees. Employee appreciation is demonstrated often, and there are programs and events that demonstrate upper management is committed to a good work/life balance.
review.cons: Cons – Downsides include internal communication of company direction and intiatives, and odd shift hours for some employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Etrade is headed in the right direction, keep up the good work! Overall a great place to be

review.title: “Overall my experience at Etrade was terrible because of management”
review.pros: Pros – The company provides alot of training and courses to educate yourself. We had access to many videos and investment courses, and the company website is very informative for both clients and employees.
review.cons: Cons – Office politics play a big role in determining promotions and the work environment is very strict for Financial Services Representatives.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Etrade management should focus on promoting individuals that do a great job and not promote individuals based on politics or personal relationships.

review.title: “Determination and communication will get you far within the company - ask how you can get ahead and you just might!”
review.pros: Pros – Young company - their youth makes them more aggressive at implementing new technologies and providing new products for the customers.Growing company - though the economic downturn has had it's toll on many companies, E*TRADE is still focused on growth. They constantly promote expanding their customer base by offering new products and undertaking more business partnerships.Fast paced - there's always something new and different happening. You may find that you're in customer service but working on other projects and working with other departments.Potential for career development - though costs can be an issue if you speak with management about improving your skills if it's a plus for the company you may get what you ask for.
review.cons: Cons – Young management - not that age makes you a more skilled manager, but a manager or team lead with 1 or 2 years of work experience in total, even with a degree, doesn't have all the skills needed to lead a group (especially when more than the half the group is older than them).Lack of focus on core functionality - new features are great for the customer, but sometimes the drive to put out new features overshadows the necessities of correcting systems that are long overdue for a fix.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More performance evaluations - a once a month/quarter/year evaluation isn't good enough for most people. Going over stats also isn't entirely giving a representative a good evaluation either.Honesty - not that you can tell your representatives everything, but for major issues it's better to let your workers know the situation than to wait until the last minute and create confusion and mistrust.

review.title: “I don't see a long term career opportunity at E*TRADE.”
review.pros: Pros – They did paid me to get my series 7 & 63. The vacation time is good.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is really bad. They are all about the negative and you are never told about the positive. Can you say Micro-Managers that get really excited about their name tag and "power".If you are licensed then stay away. If you don't have your license, leave after you get it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Not everything is a metric and a number. If you didn't focus on each individuals number, those individuals might actually spend time to work with other departments to get things done. There is too much turnover, I am tired of being one of the few people that can actually get something done, because everyone else is too new or too stupid.

review.title: “You learn very fast to get out of the way of the train.”
review.pros: Pros – The innovative culture gives you opportunities to continue with the process improvement. Internal transfers can broaden your work experiences and strengthen customer focus.
review.cons: Cons – The work place environment overly depends on competition, which reduces cooperation amongst varying departments and ranks. Also, employees are constantly in the dark, there are too many secrets.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Motivate your employees with better incentives/rewards, you can start by adopting best practices from 10 companies Best Places to Work. Stop managing people by fear, otherwise it will continue to drive away your best talent.

review.title: “Poor incestuous place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Some leadership good, flexible about work/life balance
review.cons: Cons – Horrible promotional process. very poor segmentation to clients. Horrific offshoring experiences
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – wake up and sell already!!!

review.title: “A Ok place to start out!”
review.pros: Pros – Get your Series Licenses, observe how clients are riding this market and learning from them.
review.cons: Cons – Service request that are not processed in a timely fashion and some clients complaining about our Manila Call center.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to the clients concern about Manila reps.

review.title: “Ok to work for some time. Not a great place to grow.”
review.pros: Pros – Creative. Small world.Strong in web technology.
review.cons: Cons – Slow growth.Lack of visibility to smart work.Immature process
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Value IQ and education and utilize such talent

review.title: “ETRADE isnt what it used to be but it's still alive, surprisingly.”
review.pros: Pros – There's a lot to learn at ETRADE, even for seasoned developers. I was impressed with the length of time most of the team members had been there, 6-10+ years. Some people have been there since the old glory days of ETRADE.
review.cons: Cons – In my perspective the overall technology culture at ETRADE is hampered by poor team interconnectivity and low socialization. It seemed that groups of people tended to associate primarily within their own team, or within their own culture. Not unlike a lot of other companies, but this is clearly a weakness. I would have liked to see more of a team building effort, especially at times when morale had been low. My perception of the environment is that it is extremely competitive due to the lack of trust outside of cliques.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I believe team building across cultural boundaries is sorely needed. Trust and transparency is a must. Secrets and whispering behind people's backs only adds to the division. Focus on integrating new talented developers within the ranks of the seasoned heroes of yore.

review.title: “If you have a degree, then leave.”
review.pros: Pros – benefits, short hours, time off.
review.cons: Cons – The job itself. Customers. Customers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do something about the wait times.

review.title: “Okay place to get started”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits, Knowledge gained about trading.
review.cons: Cons – Micro Management could be reduced significantly.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more consistent.

review.title: “Easy job. Decent pay. Little bit boring and one dimensional.”
review.pros: Pros – By far the benefits are the best part of the job. 3 weeks paid vacation, 1 week sick paid vacation off the bat.
review.cons: Cons – The work can be boring for somebody looking for excitement from their job. Very monotonous schedules... which can be your friend at times, and depressing other times. Soft selling is part of the job description but no compensation/bonus comes from it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management was fine. Can't ask for much more. Good people.

review.title: “good for entry level”
review.pros: Pros – entry level get series 7 and 63 licenses. good training. good experience in customer service. great if you are looking to get into sales. opportunity for future licenses (series 4, 24, ect.). good stepping stone (currently looking for another job)
