review.cons: Cons – micromanagement. breaks, lunch and start time are recorded to the second. compensation is low. will take years to earn decent living at FSR level. you potential ceiling will end at being either sales RM or a manager. creates a lot of turnover. currently looking for another job after 3 years, which is usually the case (which isn't a necessarily a con)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – manager should stick up for their reps more. be more of an advocate.

review.employee-type: Customer Service Representative In Call Center (Former Employee)
review.title: “Call center experience”
review.pros: Pros – Young managers indicate the ability for in house advancement. Relatively high end phone center job which required experience in financial services (as well as Series 7 registration). Still there are occasions for the unreasonable calls from customers who blame you for some mistake they have made. Company did make an effort to provide some outlets from the stress of making calls with a nice break area with TV, wii and ping pong tables.
review.cons: Cons – Young managers often are not experienced in managing people. Tend to be too defensive and rely to too heavily on call statistics. Senior management seldom on site. Relatively low compensation considering the skills and knowledge required for this job. However due to cost pressures, firm was moving toward lower cost call centers in other parts of the country and overseas.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior management should consider the quality as well as the quantity of calls handled by CSR in the call centers. Should look at the example of Zappo to see how a call center should be managed.

review.title: “E*TRADE Securities”
review.pros: Pros – The bonus structure rewards performance. Salary is consistent with industry standards. There are opportunities for advancement. It is an innovative company.
review.cons: Cons – For a company that espouses technology and innovation, some departments are archaic, with processes that require manual calculations froth with human errors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep technolgy in the forefront not only in the active trader brokerage business but for all business units.

review.title: “Etrade”
review.pros: Pros – Laid back work environment. Great people to work with. Good to work in an innovative and entrepreneurial style work environment
review.cons: Cons – The pay is not good at all. There is not much room for advancement. The company is trying to turn things around
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give employees more assistance in advancing their careers. Base more of the salary on performance and pay more for performance

review.title: “E*TRADE good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – - They are good about giving you time off when needed- It is possible to move positions within different departments fairly easily- Good employee benefits
review.cons: Cons – - You are on the phone all day long listening to other people's problems which can be kind of stressful- Micro management to the point where every second of your day must be accounted for
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Less micro management of employee's time - trust that your employees are going to do their job efficiently- More incentive for sales

review.title: “Good place to learn”
review.pros: Pros – Relaxed environment allows you to balance personal life and work. If you put forth the extra effort, you will have select oppurtunities for advancement.
review.cons: Cons – Little communication from top down. Low pay creates high turnover. Often becomes a case of being well liked vs. skilled. Lack of redunency at some positions means working odd hours from time to time.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay your team a little more and watch the talent level increase.

review.title: “FSR”
review.pros: Pros – This is an inbound call center--not very glamorous work, but the company knows this is a realatively lousy job and doesn't try to sugar-coat it.
review.cons: Cons – constant turn over between etrade, morgan stanley, wells, and fidelity. if you want a promotion, you have to walk across the street to another firm.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get a handle of the revolving door between Wells, ETrade, Morgan Stanley and Fidelity. Create a career path for advancement

review.title: “a waste of time”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits are okay, policies are fine, work tools are not bad, knowledge sharing system is good, working remotely or from home facilities are okay.
review.cons: Cons – Compensation is bad, managers lack some skills like communication skills, annual raises suck, no innovation or creativity encouragement, limited vision.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay employees well

review.title: “It is what you make of it.”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity to get Series 7, 63, and Series 24 licensing with company paid for training.
review.cons: Cons – Low Salary, Telephone call center environment very oppressive (if you go to the bathroom too much your manager will say something). Very rude and unknowledgable clients at the entry level.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat the people that are in the call center as important to the company because they are the first line of contact with your clients. Get rid of the Manila, Phillipines call center, just because it's cheaper does not mean it's better. By the time clients went through the ordeal of dealing with the Manila representatives they were so upset it was difficult to deal with them.

review.title: “Licensed trader on Elite Services Team”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity to become securities licensed. Learn a bit about the markets, it pays fairly well for a call center environment.
review.cons: Cons – You're in a call center environement. You're also dealing withe peoples money in a market sensitive environment. You need to have thick skina and an ability to work under pressure, fixing problems while someone is waiting right in your earset.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Call center environments are difficult places to provice advancement. It is a horizontal structure with a manager and his/her reps. Not a lot of room for moving up, though there are many opportunities to move sideways.

review.title: “Satisfying work, poor management.”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunities to grow. (To a point)Good benefits.Multiple departments to consider. (Though a lack of layers of growth within them.)
review.cons: Cons – Poor management structure.Status quo is maintained.Favoritism displayed in wreckless manner.Upper management exists at other sites, lack true visibility to what goes on.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Valuable employees will move on to other opportunities if not presented with any. Limited perception of those with value has hurt several departments. Sandy location needs more support, better leadership and leadership opportunities.

review.title: “Good place to work if you have the personality for it”
review.pros: Pros – The enviroment is very steady. You get to meet a lot of smart people who are not necessary on the super aggressive competitive mode in life. The culture is very loose and relax.
review.cons: Cons – Unfortunately the culture is very relax, to the point there was no real structure to career growth, training, reasonable promotions. It is a place where if you do not say anything, they do nothing for you, if you say a lot they MIGHT satisfy your needs.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please pay people what they are worth, recognize their efforts through promotions, especially with new graduates.

review.title: “Etrade”
review.pros: Pros – Pretty relaxed environment. They have been getting a lot less relaxed as of late, especially with the economy in bad condition.
review.cons: Cons – They don't pay very well and haven't given raises in over three years to anyone in the company unless promoted.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay your employees what they are worth or they will be unhappy and look for another job while getting paid at yours.

review.title: “Horrible place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Big name company, good market share within the industry.
review.cons: Cons – Management is a disaster. They change policies and rules every week, they change rules Monday, and fire people the next day. They cut people off who have been with the company for a while tosave money, and promote new people without pay raises. They micromanage workers so bad, watch everything you say, everything you do. The company really gets on you about what you spend 1 minute on; you are their prostitute. People at the company are so scared they if they will be fired the next day, they fire people like it's nothing, one small mistakes, you are out.The pay is so low, you will not believe series 7 brokers with exeperience only get paid that little. The amount is disgraceful. Not much room for promotion, they treat you like 5 years old, judge you, the worst company I ever worked for.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop trying to micromanage people, care about the current employees and take care of them, and stop hiring new people to cover fired people. Empower employee instead of enslaving them. Stop firing people over little things, making reports on everything to watch employees is ridiculous. Pay the people right, the brokers really do alot of work, it's barely above minimum wage.People who not get on phones should not make rules or change policies, they don't know anything about it.The back office outsourcing is a disaster. TOA department needs to be more efficient. You are losing so many customers over TOA not running efficiently, too many headaches for people who are trying to BRING the money to etrade. All your mismanagement flaws are directed to your brokers, without anything valid to say to customers made by the management. Genie balance program is horrible, customers should not have to call in to fix balances on their accounts.Pay your brokers more, people in mainstreet, and Elite.

review.title: “Get the experience and move on.”
review.pros: Pros – -Well known company to use as a stepping stone for experience in the financial industry.-Front line employees make the work environment friendly and creative.
review.cons: Cons – -Promotions most time awarded by how well you are liked rather than the quality of your work.-Constant feeling of job insecurity (which is verbalized by management).-Lack of respect from management towards front line employees.-Employees must spend just as much time protecting their position as they do performing their required duties.-Disproportionate percentage of minorities in management.- There is no in house contact for employees to go confidentially when they have problems with management. HR seems to be in a position to protect Etrade regardless of the truth in the allegations regarding the behavior of their management team.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Departmental management should be required to go through management training. Management must recognize that it is important to respect all employees equally.

review.title: “Not the worst place to work”
review.pros: Pros – The compensation was good. Decent base salary with good bonus opportunties. You work normal hours, Monday through friday nine to five no saturdays. Fairly low stress.
review.cons: Cons – The systems are horrible as is the back office. The requests you send on behalf of your customers will take for ever to get done. Micro management that you can't believe. Almost no chance of moving up in the company. Forget about raises. Constantly changing goals and focus points.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Have a more clearly defined job description for the role with more defined goals and focuses. Stop the micromanagement, improve the operations of the company, and update your systems.

review.title: “E*TRADE Financial - General View”
review.pros: Pros – E*TRADE was once a small fish in a big pond. Now with its bank, international presence, large customer base and national and global recognition it is a big player in its space. The firm can continue to grow one the bank puts its issues to rest. great company, with the need to have a change in upper mgmt (CEO and CFO) to get it back to a place where customers and employees and shareholders are smiling and believing that the firm is on a growth pattern once again.
review.cons: Cons – right now like many other firms E*TRADE is contracting and going on a holding pattern on growth. It is cost cutting certain infastructures that will only need to be built back up again during the growth period. If should really look to cut our of certain businesses and high $ exec comp.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – every copmany has a CEO, CFO, and COO to take it to a certain point then move on...Kristos had his time....Mitch made his mark, Layton did his share...now lets get a CEO who can build the trust of the ranks and instill the same vigor and enthusiam that the firm once had...

review.title: “Senior Developer”
review.pros: Pros – Good career growth with many opportunities to work with many different technologies. Compensation is OK, maybe a little lower than competition.
review.cons: Cons – Very fast paced and stressful environment. Very high turnover rate with most of their developers overseas. Management does not balance personal life with work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work on communication, many of the departments are very fragmented and difficult to coordinate to get any work done. Compensation could be better.

review.title: “man battle stations!”
review.pros: Pros – Good Environment, opportunity to advance, flexible time off. In general the people you worked with were willing to help, managers tired their best.
review.cons: Cons – No bonus, stock price is still really low, they really blew it 2 years ago and have not really recovered. The 401k match was 2% when they were doing well 3 years ago... It really makes you think when the executives used to talk about their huge profit ratio, but they only matched 2%
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – At the road show don't talk about your huge profit ratio when the compensation is lower than your competitors. Offer more defined career paths.

review.title: “good place to gain experience”
review.pros: Pros – access to trading platform and cheap commission trades, sponsorship for securities licenses that are pretty much desired, fun younge environment
review.cons: Cons – phone software program called blue pumpkin tracks all phone activity and tells you when you can take a break, go to the bathroom do emails
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – give employees more time to take care of customer problems rather than have to always be available to take calls

review.title: “Not bad, Not great”
review.pros: Pros – Love being in the financial industry and loved the corporate culture. Everything was very laid back and the work day went by quickly.
review.cons: Cons – Everything was very deceiving at making the most money for the company and customers were not of top importance which was hard.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Not much. It's a tough industry. I liked my job and the pay was fine. It would be nice to get a little more vacation though.

review.title: “Gone but not forgotten”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity for growth and advancement based on your skills. Recognition of a job well done. Atmosphere, work environment, and peers.
review.cons: Cons – Poor communication between upper management and everyone else. Unwillingness to assist employees in the balance of their professional/ personal life.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Communicate better with employees. Spport employees more in the desire to grown and advance within the organization. Treat employees with respect.

review.title: “E*Trade technology.”
review.pros: Pros – New technology, many projects, brilliant people to work with.
review.cons: Cons – .Proprietary stuff..No proper guidelines about promotions, and role definition. A junior will do same work or more then a senior, but all this does not count in review/promotions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more transparent about the management style.

review.title: “Why Bother?”
review.pros: Pros – Commission schedule was good, but I've heard has gotten worse since I left.
review.cons: Cons – They don't listen to the right feedback. They wear blinders to the reps advice and continue in what they think is best, but clearly has not turned out to be best.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay more attention to your reps, not just formal feedback where they are nervous but on the floor where they speak their minds.

review.title: “E*Trade Financial is a joke.”
review.pros: Pros – Good technology. If you are in the architecture group it'll be great because u get to explore and learn different technologies..do your trial and errors etc...otherwise if u end up just doing dev work, do it for 2 yrs and u don't learn anymore except kissing up and BS-ing
review.cons: Cons – Product Mgrs @ETFC from Customer Service! One know the buzz words and kiss-ups to move up the corp ladder.Don't even know how to trade except simple equity orders.Don't have a clue what brokerage is or even what the competitiion is doing.Business side emp most are a joke.Salary is horrible compare to other companies.The only way to move up is the kiss the right 'S'.They try to act professional but all they know is just buzz words.They are just plain sales people who lies
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Leaders @ETFC?MOre like Followers IMO. You kiss the right person and hope for a promotion. You scratch my back and I'll scratch yours.One person I knew got a promotion in 6 months fresh out of college! and then 5 months later promoted to mgr (he started as a software engr).He didn't do much except kissed the right butt.Barely chk in any code but still able to move up.

review.title: “Needs more smiles.”
review.pros: Pros – The size of the company means there's less overhead to be bogged down with. There is opportunity to get stuff done and work on interesting projects.
review.cons: Cons – The atmosphere and morale is pretty low. People crowd around the TV showing CNBC whenever the stock takes a dive.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to boost morale somehow at the company

review.title: “Not for everyone, but great for certain types”
review.pros: Pros – At E*TRADE, almost anyone can have the opportunity to take the lead on an initiative, whether initiated by others or their own. You can quickly go up a learning curve and develop new skills. It's fairly easy to get a cross-functional education and transition to work in different roles and departments. You have the opportunity to work on industry-leading creative, innovative products and services.
review.cons: Cons – Most of E*TRADE works at an extremely fast pace and can be a very chaotic environment that often leads to unecessary mistakes. Smoe may not appreciate the effect of this on the user experience. This can also lead to inconsistent rewards and recognition for employees, and can be too agressive a culture for some.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay closer attention to and reward more fairly the many talented individual contributors who build and maintain the exceptional products and service

review.title: “Not a bad company”
review.pros: Pros – Great flexibility with your schedule, several shifts are offered. The benifits this company offers are great, including 4 weeks of paid time off from day one which is much higher than the industry standard. The salary is not bad, but is is not enough to keep you from looking for another job.
review.cons: Cons – the company is constantly being investigated for some sort of legal issue such as interpositioning in trades and things of that nature. Also they are starting to heavily rely upon call center reps based in the Philipines who don't know the first thing about the brokerage industry, or english for that matter.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire domestic workers!

review.title: “Miserable Experience”
review.pros: Pros – Fast paced environment. Get to speak to people of different backgrounds and learn new things on a daily basis. Alllows you to keep up with the investment world and relay that information to investors. Opportunity to educate investors and prospects on self directed investing. You get to trade in your own accounts at the employee discount rate, which isn't bad. Hard to find many positives, cause there were very few for me. Colleagues are fun to work with and make it a little bit easier to get through the day. Trading systems were very good and easy to use for me.
review.cons: Cons – Entirely too many calls on daily basis. 100 plus calls a day with the majority of them coming from somebody that has trouble with the English language and they are upset about something. Company and team leads and managers are too controlling. Something screws up on a daily basis. Whether it's the website or trading systems or anything else you can think of, there's a good chance it will be broken when you get to work or before you leave. The company is being ran in to the ground and they expect you to work "mandatory" "voluntary" overtime to help explain this to the customers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Sell the company or merge with TD or Schwab.

review.title: “Etrade is the best brokerage job to get started in the industry.”
review.pros: Pros – Etrade is a great place if you like to just show up and do your job and not get hassled by your boss. People that are senior to you are excellent and actually care about their employees. As long as you do what you are supposed to then they stay out of your business completely.
review.cons: Cons – There is basically nowhere to go as far as advancement goes. You start there making 40K and you could work there for 25 years and make 45 or 55K max. It's a GREAT job for a student or someone that is just breaking in the industry. Just don't go in there with the idea that you are going to grab the world by the tail because Etrade is not the place to accomplish that.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None, management is very fair. My boss was a "no bs" type of guy but he was great at giving all of his employees plenty of space. All the other managers are similar.

review.title: “I recommend their services, but not employment.”
review.pros: Pros – It's a good business model (mortgage issues aside) and has great products and services. The website and cash management services are user-friendly and generally problem-free. The pace of development and technology make it an exciting place to work.
review.cons: Cons – Employees are treated as disposable. There is no focus on health or wellness, and employees who ask for modified schedules to care for their family are frequently denied. The HR department serves only to police the employees and deliver bad news.The constantly revolving leadership team makes for frequent changes to priorities and goals.There are different standards for every department, with the "less valuable" areas receiving very little in the way of perks or moral boosters.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Your employees are your best asset. Treat them with respect. Retain the successful leaders, and eliminate those who get caught up in the power struggle and inter-departmental politics.

review.title: “Nice place to learn and advance your career...not for too long though”
review.pros: Pros – Great learning opportunity, great benefits package, awesome brokerage platform, good marketing by the company. ETRADE (Arlington) is also VERY involved in the community, e.g. homeless out-reach programs, elementary school visits, toys for tots around the holidays etc.
review.cons: Cons – Senior management can be aloof and disinterested, instant messaging seems to be the only way to communicate with co-workers. Stock price cant seem to break the $2 mark. Nervous about the economy and if ETRADE will react accordingly. Lots of customer service are out-sourced to Manilla.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take more time to learn about the "little people" that work under you, help us develop our career by introducing us to new tasks.

review.title: “a review”
review.pros: Pros – a great place to get experience, it forces you to adapt to changing situations
review.cons: Cons – management was always reacting to problems (and badly) instead of anticipating them. Too many legacy systems, and too many changes, then unchanges
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't ever, ever, let the ETBank people run the company again

review.title: “Ok Company to work for if you are not ambitious.”
review.pros: Pros – large stable organization and there is a lot of work; it being an financial services company, its not going to run out of projects but the downside is that it is not a technical orgnanization hence, you may get stuck with legacy apps and maintenance.
review.cons: Cons – one can get pigeon holed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get to know your employees

review.title: “Good management at local level, but not a ton of opportunity for advancement.”
review.pros: Pros – The bonus was good when reasonable targets were set by senior management, and it was a fun atmosphere most of the time.
review.cons: Cons – Very hard to get things done because of the way things are set up. While there are some good people in the back office, it's generally just gets in the way of getting things done.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide a more clear career path.

review.title: “Great company to START a career if we pull through the market turmoil”
review.pros: Pros – Get your series 7 and 63 while being paid a competitive salaryUpward advancement availableLaid back enviroment
review.cons: Cons – Uncertinity of where the company is headedMay be bought out or worse in the near futureVERY unprof. at times
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The employees of ETrade depend on you to lead us through this mess, dont turn your backs on us like the last management team. Focus on keeping E-Trade a float and PLEASE dont sell us off or let us go bankrupt like a few other competitors in the industry.

review.title: “Will not feel like you work in a smooth running environment.”
review.pros: Pros – Camaraderie. Some good opportunities for advancement. Closure of several offices means more work for associates who remain, good if you don't mind working OT, not so good if you're susceptible to burnout.
review.cons: Cons – Will sometimes hire from outside rather than promote from within. Some in management are clueless. Used to be a good place to get a start in finance but now they're only hiring experienced and licensed brokers. Always get the feeling that you're expendable and not appreciated.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Understand that front line associates are integral to your business. Should maybe start recognizing that fact.

review.title: “Great place to get experience but not a place for a long term career”
review.pros: Pros – Creative compnay and a great place to get in on the ground floor to get industry experience. ETRADE offers excellent opportunities for people to get their foot in the door of the financial services industry. You will even get the opportunity to move around to different areas.
review.cons: Cons – This is a fast moving company and there is allot of turnover, reorganization, and offshoring. Couple this with the history of unstable financial stability and you will rarely if ever feel job security.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you're doing. Strip it down and get it ready for sale. But in the meantime make sure you are not making empty promises or misleading employees.

review.title: “E*TRADE is an innovative company that has a strong culture yet wrought with many opportunities for job growth.”
review.pros: Pros – The best reasons to work for E*TRADE is that firstly there are a lot of opportunities to work on many different projects and initiatives. There are many different initiatives the company undertakes. Thus opportunities generally seek you out first. Secondly, if you like to get things done, E*TRADE has a culture of getting big projects done in very little time. That can be exciting on the one hand and challenging on the other. Lastly, the company is huge on innovation. The company thrives very much on coming up with new products and tools to improve the experience of all our customers.
review.cons: Cons – As with any company there are certainly some downsides with working at E*TRADE. The first is that there is always a lack of human resources. Given that the company is always trying to keep costs down this is the biggest challenge especially when the company has so many big ambitions. On the one hand it means that there are a lot of opportunities. On the other hand it becomes a challenge to get everything done. The second is that with any financial company, there are a lot of regulatory procedures that must be adhered to. These can certainly get in the way of completing projects in a timely manner.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Despite the troubles in the industry, continue to seek opportunities to invest.

review.title: “Fun, dynamic company to work for, but not an easy place to be due to turmoil and uncertainty.”
review.pros: Pros – Fun culture, dynamic business. Lots of opportunities to learn about various retail financial services.
review.cons: Cons – Balance sheet is a wreck due to the HELOC assets. It will be awhile before it is put back together, and when it is, my opinion is that it will be sold to a competitor.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Clean up the balance sheet. It will be tough to attract and retain talented people otherwise. Those that remain will do so because they are unemployable elsewhere or scared of the current economy. Not the people you need to turn the company around.

review.title: “Life at E*Trade from the line level employee's view.”
review.pros: Pros – There is constant change happening at E*Trade so there will always be new and challenging things for the motivated employee. Since the company is small and in a constant state of change there are ample opportunities to shape your own role and take on additional challenges and responsibilities. The workplace is an EXTREMELY liberal company and the dress code is a very relaxed business casual. Discrimination is almost non-existent at E*Trade so you can be pretty well assured that you will be welcomed no matter who you are. The Arlington, VA office is in a great location just 4 miles West of DC in one of the most diverse areas of the nation.
review.cons: Cons – The company is caught in the midst of the credit crunch. There have been multiple layoffs as well as a recent hiring and promotion freeze. It can be difficult working at a company where there may or may not be a future for you. Senior management very rarely promotes from within the ranks which is due in part to the total lack of a development program. To succeed at E*Trade you have to be a truly self motivated go-getter willing to take on additional tasks as well as the established power structure. New executive level management does not communicate at all past the executive level. Directors down to the line level employees are complete in the dark in regards to the company‘s financial direction and stability.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do more to retain valued employees. E*Trade does a poor job of developing talent from within the ranks.

review.title: “To live and die at E*trade”
review.pros: Pros – Etrade is a great place to begin a career in Finance. Getting you feet wet is mandatory from day one. They do take great care in training you properly for the position and provide ample time and training for getting all necessary licenses. Once all licenses have been acquired, further training is given to further improve your job performance. Also, self training in other fields and topics within the financial field is encouraged. Being originally a dot com company, the work atmosphere was fairly relaxed but was changing considerably when I left. The casual dress attire at work was still in place and definitely made for a more comfortable work environment.
review.cons: Cons – The long hours required. Overtime is generally mandatory. The minimum standards and quotas needed to be met at work was strictly monitored and can be extremely overbearing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Cultivate the employees more. The work environment and the constant need to meet your "numbers" was stressful and numbing. This pressure seemed to come from the top since most supervisors I knew were also under the same kind of stress.

review.title: “E*TRADE flexible overall, but get a good manager. Great place for a student, but may not be a full time career”
review.pros: Pros – E*TRADE is a very mellow and easy going employer. However, how easy going depends on your Manager. Some managers look the other way while others are very strict and to the point. Additionally, they give you a month to study for the series 7 and they pay you while you are doing it. They have excellent study guides for passing this difficult test. They do not ask for a specific length of time after they pay for you passing the 7. So you may use E*TRADE to get it and go somewhere else that pays more
review.cons: Cons – In customer service you always see the worse things that happen, that being said they do seem to lose a plethora of paperwork and can be slow to correct their mistakes. Their pay is somewhat on the low side and they can be slow to give raises. But their ability to work with families and busy students makes this easy to overlook
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to what the employees want. It will not do any good to make rules that will drive employees away

review.title: “Great place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Great talent, technology and very motivated people.
review.cons: Cons – Balance sheet aspect, timing is not good as financial industries are going through downward spiral and ET is not exception.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Employee retention, motivation and vision for company going forward will be the key for success for ET and management must look into these.

review.title: “A good company to work for with some occasional Back office operational hiccups.”
review.pros: Pros – Good company to work for. Technology and innovation focused. Just needs a little work in the Operations departments and the programs we use to help customers need to stop crashing or being incredibly slow at random times during the day. Aside from that there is a lot of good to be said about the company and I do enjoy working there (I'm lucky to have a great manager, too).
review.cons: Cons – Some of the supervisors working in the Operations department kill me sometimes. There are some great ones and others that I cannot believe have not been let go yet. They defy all logic and common sense. I wish they had the customer in mind back there instead of doing whatever the heck they try not to do. I'd give anything to put some of the supervisors back there on the phones for just one week (their direct reports do a better job than them honestly).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Fix Genie. Fix Operations. Fix VISA card and checkbook issues. 'Nuff said.

review.title: “Working at E*TRADE”
review.pros: Pros – Interesting work, growth potential of the company, good people.
review.cons: Cons – Management decisions are sometimes made without complete understanding of the details of the daily workings.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – see above.

review.title: “good to get your license but no growth”
review.pros: Pros – easy to get foot in the door and some good employees. easy to get your licenses. good employees discounts on broker services and bank rates with high interest.
review.cons: Cons – no growth; bad management and communication. management treats employees like children, and there is no attention paid to suggestions for improvement. not proactive in solving problems and would rather sweep them under the rug; people more concerned with covering themselves and office politics rather than improving the firm.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – more transparency with employees and invest more in competent service

review.title: “E*TRADE is a good place to work but a little unorganized”
review.pros: Pros – E*TRADE is a very fast-paced environment where employees learn to multi-task and utilize a variety of resources to complete the task at hand. Opportunities for professional development are plentiful. Employees have an opportunity to learn many different software applications. The environment also provides very much information to employees about the goings-on in the stock market.
review.cons: Cons – Management is inconsistent. Constantly changing managers results in starting/stopping of projects and confused employees. The company also has multiple locations throughout the U.S. and resources have been juggled between those sites over the years. I think employees in some of the current locations are probably scared that their location will be closed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Choose a path and stick to it.

review.title: “Do not work for Etrade”
review.pros: Pros – They paid to get my series 7, 63
review.cons: Cons – Constant layoffs, little opportunity for advancement, very poor training on company procedures. No raises in over a year, miserable employee morale, having to deal with outsourced representatives from Manilla, no community involvement to speak of, no accountablity for clients isssues, performance reviews are only held once a year, incompetent mangement with extremely poor communication skills. The monotony of dealing with the same rediculous call transfers that are totally unecessay from incompetent morons with no understanding of the brokerage industry, or company policies and procedures. Losing your job with very little notice or assitance finding employment.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They suck, and ran the company into the ground due to poor investment decisions.

review.title: “honest”
review.pros: Pros – experience, and the have a good software for trading
review.cons: Cons – this is an environment were it's who you know and hang out with rather then performance
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – the feedback i get is very vague i was only told what i did wrong and never what the issue was and what to do to improve in the eye of the company

review.title: “Fun Experience”
review.pros: Pros – friendly working environment.family oriented.has a lot of community related activities.curricular activities for employees
review.cons: Cons – don't value employee so much.not a lot of incentives
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Fantastic experience.. u guys need to look out for this one”
review.pros: Pros – Timely food and salary IQ/Skills/Personality work space environment
review.cons: Cons – very strict officers.. might be bugging at times.. never mind the compensation was good so just survuved there

review.title: “Great Experience”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to think & execute ideas
review.cons: Cons – Too many managers to report to at the same time!!
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Variable compensation; Overall experience largely dependent on location and manager”
review.pros: Pros – The product spectrum is expanding, and as consultants, we have quite a bit of flexibilty and control over what we present to clients and how. Some of the folks on the sales distribution team are great and really focus their resources on helping FC's succeed.
review.cons: Cons – - The comp plan changes frequently. The newest change makes it difficult to gauge how your bonus is progressing throughout the quarter if you have clients who are active traders (despite the fact that all that trading actually makes E*TRADE money).- While it's nice that you're given a book of business to start with, it's extremely difficult to remove clients from your book who don't belong there. You may end up with people who have no contact info, who have no desire to speak with you, or who don't live locally (if you're in a branch),.- Some branch managers seem great to work with, others can be micro-managers or number crunchers who aren't very helpful in their role to foster sales growth. Some branches work well together, others may have FC's who rarely interact with one another.- If you don't have an operations person in your branch, then be prepared to waste some time here and there on service issues or paperwork.- Some of the leads we get are complete garbage, yet you're still hounded by management if you don't properly attempt them several times and prove that you've exhausted all avenues to uncover business. I'd rather focus on actual opportunities than satisfy some arbitrary requirement.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Credit admin”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible place to work at...
review.cons: Cons – they take advantage of people and make them work hard but don't pay them the money worth their job
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – No comments

review.title: “Awesome atmosphere, highly intelligent co-workers, and competitive pay”
review.pros: Pros – o Great people to work with, great atmosphere, and very subtle politics among management people (one that is not obvious and weighing on the rank-and-file workers).o Competitive salary.o Fair performance appraisal, which may result in a bonus.o Night and day shift jobs.
review.cons: Cons – o Holidays are US-based; work still ongoing on Philippine holidays (but I guess that's a Pro for the double pay!).o Management doesn't seem to want to keep their agents with the company (little to no agent retention).o Management seems to want to maximize an agent for all their worth and not look into increasing their pay.o Benefits are standard but nothing extra to make you want to stay with the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You guys might want to improve on your agent retention. E*TRADE is not just a "stepping stone" company. You might want to have agents work there until retirement. Loyal agents build goodwill for the company and touch your clients in a profound way. And please look into better employee benefits and aligning their pay to their workload.

review.title: “Really strong technology company”
review.pros: Pros – E*Trade has one of the strongest technology teams I have seen. It has a great working environment and many of the people have been with E*Trade for a number of years. This makes them very knowledgeable in what they do and that makes things so much easier
review.cons: Cons – The only issue with E*Trade is stability of the company. You hear so many rumors of it getting acquired or not having a rosy future, you feel like you are on an unstable platform that may topple any minute.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Company has moved to hard sales. Not the E*TRADE I once knew....”
review.pros: Pros – For the work required the pay is pretty good. I have generally had a good experience with the people I work with...they generally do not hire the kind of person one normally associates with a brokerage firm (slicked hair, angry etc). Good base pay. I have made many, many friends who I will always be in contact with. Local Management has always been good to me.They are very good about not requiring late hours, weekend work etc.
review.cons: Cons – The comp plan for sales associates is the worst thing that has ever been excreted out of a human mind. Its very core is designed to cost you money at every turn. Client dies? Likely you will lose money. Client buys a house? You lose money. Client sells Mutual Funds? You lose money. And don't confuse this with a loss of retention or some hypothetical loss of continuing payments. You literally are charged from your bonus dollar for dollar. In other words, everything you sell will one day come back to cost you just as much, if not more (if it's value went up), than you were paid to sell it in the first place. Thousands of dollars a quarter will disappear due to things you have 0 control over. I won't go into too much detail, but I will say that when this plan was introduced to me I scoffed at the hypothetical losses I saw coming.Unfortunately they are not hypothetical anymore.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They live in their own world. I won't bother.

review.title: “weighed down by poor management”
review.pros: Pros – great benefits, most people are easy to work with. work/life balance is great.
review.cons: Cons – management is poor and mired by favoritism. senior management has their pets who get promoted every year while high producing employees are passed over every year. there is a culture of saying no. projects have 17 rounds of approvals, and everyone is looking to say no.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – get fresh talent from outside the company. too many internal hirings leads to an army of yes-men.

review.title: “Good Company”
review.pros: Pros – Fast pace, great learning environment for new to the financial service industry
review.cons: Cons – long hours, temp worker layoffs
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Tips for assessing and reported this company”
review.pros: Pros – I support the high-income jobs and support the places near the place of residence for more than a remote factor I support the diverse functions and not just one function
review.cons: Cons – I hate the lack of diversity of languages ??and the lack of training courses for short periods
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – My advice is as follows: on the company to evolve and expand dramatically and fast at the same time and this happens to increase, especially the basic languages ??such as Arabic and ... Etc. Second, targeting people with popular on Facebook and advertising for this company Thirdly targeting their pockets full of people and people with influence locally and internationally, as people living in the Persian Gulf are the focal point for many companies that have become rich and globalI would advise to also target people from the countries of its currency cheap, because they would receive a wage high value and will work hard

review.title: “Limited advancement in uncertain economy plaques company.”
review.pros: Pros – Good pay and benefits, God work schedules
review.cons: Cons – Doom and gloom at line level employees, hard to motivate without incentives.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give management tools to help morale.

review.title: “It is an overall ok place to work for.”
review.pros: Pros – Relaxing environment, good place to work if u like screwing over customers.
review.cons: Cons – The company hires very inexperienced people that have no business working in the financial field. I worked in the margins department and managers and supervisors are really incompetent and have really screwed over clients because they really don't know what they are doing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – hire smarter people that have skills talent in the financial industry, don't just hire them because they have a degree.

review.title: “good place to start but not to grow”
review.pros: Pros – lots of leads, good tools
review.cons: Cons – changing comp plan, no wealth transfer focus
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Little guidance and training, but generally satisfactory.”
review.pros: Pros – Decent pay, incentives to perform.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of structure and guidance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – See cons.

review.title: “Opportunity but pay is not sufficient”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunities abound and able to learn a new job without experience
review.cons: Cons – Work hard but pay is not in line with level of work

review.title: “ok place to work”
review.pros: Pros – very good at keeping prdn systems running, despite all the best efforts of the entire company to hose it (unintentional ofcourse).
review.cons: Cons – no respect for people. old timers are taking the company for a ride. way behind on technological advances, major decision making powers are centered within a few individuals/groups, who have least concern about company good, majorly looking to add buzzwords to their skills, resulting in half-cooked efforts.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management needs to trust new talent from outside instead of few favorite people being promoted, irrespective of their capability or skills.

review.title: “Tremendous work, horrible pay.”
review.pros: Pros – E*TRADE Financial, also known as Microsoft of the East, has many areas that can be improved upon. From a heavy dependence on excel, to disconnected systems, employees are faced with using multiple applications to do 1 of their many job functions. With this, there are many opportunities to take initiative and improve processes and technologies. At one point, the company produced an employee survey, providing employees a voice about their work experience.
review.cons: Cons – E*TRADE Financial does not pay its employees competitive salaries. The lowest score the company received from the above mentioned survey was salary satisfaction (Arlington location, at least). Upper management chalked that up to "all companies have low employee salary satisfaction". The company has taken no initiative to correct, nor improve the situation. While there are several opportunities to improve the company's processes and technologies, employees are not competitively compensated for it. E*TRADE Financial does give good bonuses, but they are not for a job well done, it's used to justify the low salary. Upper management has often threatened to to reduce bonus pay out and has never made it a guarantee, like salary. Many employees have been known to work hard, accomplish improvements, then leave the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Leadership should not be afraid to challenge the status quo and adjust salaries to keep the talented and valuable. Do the salary research. Look at your employee's experience and what they can do to improve the core businesses. If employees are good at their jobs, the company should be able to cut excess spending on unused contractor work (for example). Employee salary increases in the balance sheet and income statement, coupled with decreases in certain operational spending is a sign that the company is relying on its employees - valuating the talented and positioning itself to retain the best employee workforce.

review.title: “Learned a lot.”
review.pros: Pros – Etrade is a very large and well respected US business!
review.cons: Cons – Sadly, due to the recession they have no longer have a UK operation.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “So so”
review.pros: Pros – Reasonable work hours and stressNice office with great river view
review.cons: Cons – Poor managementNo exciting projectsLots of bureaucracyBelow market compensation
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “one terrible place on the earth”
review.pros: Pros – lots of open source technologya few good toolsconstantly trying to reduce the overhead towards technology - like the whole site is running on tools of no dollar spent.
review.cons: Cons – there is a lots of gang and groupism at the management level. The management hat is misused to throw away people that dont fall in line with management especially teams like build and release. Demonstrates completely unprofessional and unethical practices. Unfortunately, senior management is deaf to complaints because you cannot cross over the barrier. The bonus and salary hike stays with a few individuals that are whims and fancies to local management. This place is a great example of atrocity and bureaucracy in IT industry. The people that are sincere, are treated like commodities. You have to work on public holidays because the guys running the management feel, they own your personal life. Since the whole thing operates like a solid ring, there is no way, you can get in and do something professional. This place should be inspected by Department of Labor for fair practices
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – not much to say as enough has been said in the cons section. Someone higher up, should really come down and investigate the site before DOL looks at it.

review.title: “Good time”
review.pros: Pros – great experience, work related technologies are always being explored for new or innovative ways of doing things.
review.cons: Cons – hard to get promoted to senior management levels. Often will hire in management rather than promote from within.

review.title: “Call Center”
review.pros: Pros – They will pay you while you train to get your seven and sixty-three license. Paid days off for market holidays.
review.cons: Cons – Call Center environment. Be prepared to feel like you have no control and you are constantly micromanaged. You are not a broker at this place, you are a glorified phone monkey.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – While it is constantly preached to help the client, currently the only thing that matters is identifying clients that have additional assets to bring in.

review.title: “An educational opportunity that provide valueable experience to carry to a new job.”
review.pros: Pros – E*Trade was a very polite and respectful place to work, I was happy to be there each day, the pace varied depending on the market conditions/tax season, but it was generally pleasant.
review.cons: Cons – lack of opportunity for advancement from service to a more strategic role.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide more opportunity for movement, lateral or vertical. The FSR role felt disconnected from the rest of the staff, as if it was undeserving of the respect that a operations role might get.

review.title: “good place to work as a junior engineer”
review.pros: Pros – you will learn a lot of new stuff at the first couple of years. generally rewards come to people working hard.
review.cons: Cons – sometimes people prefer finger-pointing when the issues come up instead of working together to resolve it. also the salary level is under industry average.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – reduce the process that make production cycle inefficient. also should promote people inside company during group reorg instead of bringing new people in.

review.title: “Damage Control”
review.pros: Pros – Managers are typically young since there is a great deal of attrition of employees. Could be a good place to work if you quickly wanted to rise to a branch manager position just to get some experience. Good for entry level. Decent trade platform, and sales technology (salesforce).
review.cons: Cons – Terrible communication to employees, in every aspect, which is carried over to clients.Low compensation, high pressure - compared to industry. Constant damage control, and mixed messages. Long hours are normal in industry, but at ETFC the extra effort doesn't translate to much higher pay. Company often raise sales goals unrealistically high so as not to pay out bonuses. Company has been in financial trouble and getting bad press since 2007.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Communicate better with employees, they understand the company has landed on tough times. But the poor communication does not instill much loyalty, and hence leads to very high attrition and low quality of employees.

review.title: “Constantly Experimenting/Screwing with Sales”
review.pros: Pros – E*TRADE offers a base salary with slightly below average benefits. You will work 8am to 5pm with optional overtime to increase your bonus and no need to take your work home. It's pretty hard to get fired in most offices unless you do something dumb or are lazy for an extended period of time.
review.cons: Cons – They are constantly experimenting and end up screwing over the consultants in Sales. They just changed the compensation plan this year and it looks like more than 30% of consultants are getting no bonus for last quarter. I was in the top 20% and my bonus was only $10k for the whole quarter. Many people that are in the top 10% just got lucky with one big lead. Don’t plan to make much more than $65k a year unless you are pretty darn good. If you are amazing you might barely break $100k. Also the 401k match is an awful 2.5% and they give no salary raises at all, no matter how tenured or good you are.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you want to retain top talent don't take away their leads. Asked your "sales distribution team" or any consultant who hasn't been told by their regional manager to keep their mouth shut; the leads are gone. The best leads are new accounts, rollovers, and TOAs in, not because those leads are easy money, but because money getting moved in to E*TRADE is the most receptive to advice (mutual funds, MIP, and UMA). If you want consultants to sell advice don't take away their best leads.Even more importantly, don't take away the best leads and double the number of consultants at the same time. We are sitting in an office with twice as many people as we had a year ago and none of us have any leads to call and all of us are starting to simmer. The best of us will be taking jobs at TD, Fidelity, and Schwab in the next year if this crap doesn't change and you will be left with the new people and the underperformers.

review.title: “Improving; Management is working on improving employee satisfaction.”
review.pros: Pros – Blend of technology and finance industries has potential for diverse career paths. The employee bank account has no charges for ATM withdrawals from any ATM nationally.
review.cons: Cons – The company is quite inward looking; slow to pick up industry standards on the technology side, tending more toward in-house innovations. While this has served the company well historically, it limits the potential for employee growth
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to invest in people (training) to drive innovation. Provide opportunities for employees to visit other departments in order to see the impact their work makes to the company.

review.title: “Learned a lot but very little room for growth from position”
review.pros: Pros – Gained good experienceTraining was excellentColleauges were great
review.cons: Cons – Pay was not competive with similar positionsManagement very hands on - leaves no room for autonomy
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Change the entire model to be more in line with competitors and pay more

review.title: “Unrewarding”
review.pros: Pros – You receive paid training for Series 7 and 63. They have a higher than average pass rate. The last 5 classes have had 100 percent pass rate.
review.cons: Cons – You will receive no feed back what so ever regarding your performance unless you are a phone rep and you screw up.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – REWARD the people who are running your teams!! Bringing in treats to meetings doesnt cut it. You have already lost how many leads? And you refuse to do anything about them leaving.

review.title: “Good to start you work, but no long term career growth”
review.pros: Pros – have chance to use new and emergent technology
review.cons: Cons – promotion is hard, quite often they are not base on performance
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – talented ppl are leaving , do something to stop it

review.title: “great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – room for advancement and promotion opportunities
review.cons: Cons – long hours and frantic pacerude customers
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Mediocre at best and silo'ed”
review.pros: Pros – Most managers at E*TRADE allow some flexible scheduling to balance work-life commitments. A good employee can easily skate through without much effort.
review.cons: Cons – The employees at E*TRADE are mediocre.Most of the people have worked at the company way too long.Leadership is poor.The pay is toward the bottom of its peers.Projects take too long to complete.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – E*TRADE needs to change and innovate. The VP ranks really need to be assessed and renewed. Steven really needs to implement the changes he announced shortly after he arrived.

review.title: “It's a job...”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits, being asked about the E*TRADE baby when you tell people where it is that you work. Not much else at all.
review.cons: Cons – Promotions and recognition are hard to come by. Very stressful work environment with constant unreasonable timelines. Pay is not as good as comparable companies.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great place to start off to gain some experience but would not recommend for long haul”
review.pros: Pros – E*trade has a strong culture of innovation and being an industry leader in technology. It has navigated the credit crisis very well and has survived which cannot be said for many larger firms. It has conducted a stellar turnaround and emerged a stronger firm than from where it stood 3 years ago. The people are committed and proud of what they do. There is a culture of ownership and creativity. It is a very good place to learn the business and grow your wings.
review.cons: Cons – The salary structure at E*Trade is significantly below industry standards. Most people make significantly less than they're counterparts at bigger firms.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you're doing but do not forget that there are several areas where the company can grow and those are being overlooked

review.title: “Started great, but when the stock went from $18 a share to less than $1, the atmosphere was pretty bleak!”
review.pros: Pros – good people. cooperative. flexible work schedule. nice balance of personal and professional life.
review.cons: Cons – lack of strong management.. a pervasive lack of professionalism.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – promote quality employees

review.title: “Generic”
review.pros: Pros – Encourage growth and creativity. The work environment and culture is relaxed, professional and encouraging. I havent encountered a single instance where I was worried or apprehensive. I could find support in my colleagues and also my manager.
review.cons: Cons – One thing I noticed at the at the particular office I worked was "too much flexibility" in timing. Some folks too the word "flexibility" literally.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I would recommend to encourage more. Ask if the employee wants to do more than whats assigned. Be it new certification or training.

review.title: “Etrade should definitely be the last option”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefitsFriendly co-workersSocial eventsOpen door policyCan be promoted based on performanceSeveral differenct shifts to choose from
review.cons: Cons – Micro managementfeel like a roboteverything is monitorednothing rewarding about the actual jobhave to deal with rude customers
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give employees more room to be creative. Everything should not be so structured. If employees were given a little but more breathing room, maybe there wouldn't be such high turnover.

review.title: “This company does not know what it is doing. Except perhaps looking to sell it to someone else. Not a customer friendly”
review.pros: Pros – People know the name and commercials.
review.cons: Cons – Little chance for real growth. Very inside boys club have to make friends with others to get some where. And the next "step" is a dead end too, often with no salary bump.Not a customer friendly.Everything is based on "metrics" often with no relation to real efficiency or performance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They will not care or listen. Very disrespectful to employees and customers. it should stop at some point.

review.title: “Salary / Compensation”
review.pros: Pros – compared to any other call center in manila, somehow you will earn much more working with this company. but work loads is superb, stressful and exhausting and you will end comparing your salary with your counterpart in the US.
review.cons: Cons – 1000 pesos per month for your meal allowance? guess it's not enough. my previous work provide 3500 for meal and transpo (jp morgan chase). no hazard pay as well
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – you're really gettin most out of us, doing outbound, inbound, correspondence at the same time. doing back up with other departments but giving us no compensation at all. no quarter/semi annual bonus. annual bonus depends on employee stat but i am not sure if senior managers here are qualified at all. no teambuildings sponsored by the company. no retirement accounts either.

review.title: “E*TRADE is a good place to learn”
review.pros: Pros – Nice physical work environments. No weekends. Decent benefits. Not overly difficult. Don't ask for too much.
review.cons: Cons – Variable compensation package is impossible to discern where you should emphasize. It is so complicated nobody it has no impact on productivity. They don't treat people with a whole lot of respect. Very negative environment-always looking for metrics to punish you with rather than reward.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop looking for ways to punish.

review.title: “Supervisory”
review.pros: Pros – Easy work, flexible hours, opportunities to grow.
review.cons: Cons – Slow to progress upwards in management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more noticing that our product managers make more bad changes than good changes.

review.title: “Ok place to work, not great, not bad”
review.pros: Pros – Company has flexible working schedule to meet personal issues. It also has pretty comprehensive benefits package compared to some of the other companies.
review.cons: Cons – Senior management lacks communication with employees. Some people seem to advance because of their ties with upper management instead of their performance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to have more open communication with employee and reward those who are deserving instead of people who just have connections with upper management.

review.title: “AN OK PLACE TO WORK.”
review.pros: Pros – This is an innovative company.
review.cons: Cons – Other tha the trading platforms, other area are archaic.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Each department should be able to take calls for their areas of expertise. Some RM's cannot explain margin calls- and they can't transfer complicated margin issues to specialists. Use the Fidelity Investments model where each department specialists are thoroughly trained, take calls relating to their areas of expertise. This improves customer satisfaction .

review.title: “Good for getting your licenses and learning about the market, that's IT!”
review.pros: Pros – In Alpharetta, you get sponsored for the Series 7 and 63. Get those licenses and then you're free to go anywhere else in the country and make money. You also get to learn a lot about the market. Also by looking at customers accounts and your calls with them, you see what NOT to do! They are good about letting you take time off EXCEPT for during tax season which is Jan til Apr 15. Sometimes it's not even busy and they say no.
review.cons: Cons – Eliminate the "Command Center." It's a room built in Alpharetta, GA with the sole purpose of micromanaging call center reps. If a rep isn't back on the phone promptly after a phone call, then the Command Center questions the manager of the rep, then the manager questions the Team Lead, then the Team Lead questions the rep. Meanwhile the rep could be busy trying to solve a problem for a customer.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get rid of that whole "Command Center". It's such a joke. Get rid of reps in Manila except to do simple password resets or operations where they don't interact with customers. The customers don't like outsourcing, especially in this economic climate. Also many of the reps in Manila are kind but they are very robotic, sticking totally the script and lacking emotion.

review.title: “Good Benefits”
review.pros: Pros – The benefits package was excellent compared to other companies I've worked for in the past. The balance between work and home life is a definate plus.
review.cons: Cons – The opportunities for career advancement are only good if you start out at a higher management level. Salary is on the low end vs competitors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Promotions and salary adjustments should be based more on merit rather than tenure. A lot of employees have left due to lack of career advancement.

review.title: “Unless you bake cookies and feed everyone at work- you won't get anywhere.”
review.pros: Pros – Semi Stable job, personal trading is limited but not as limited as outside companies, good hours, i would consider outside offers before looking here.
review.cons: Cons – No pay increase for over 3 years, bonuses are low, management makes sure you know you are replaceable. Many of my peers hate there job and just stay because of a poor job market.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Review your long term Sr. Managers and above, its club to them and they not only show no respect to anyone below them but they show no respect to each other.

review.title: “Fair organzation when it comes to promotion”
review.pros: Pros – Freedom, roll up your sleve attitude, ability to really make a change and have an impact, overall competence of senior management
review.cons: Cons – matrix organization leading to lack of decision taking, need for a bigger and more ambitious vision for the product, lack of customer centricity
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – think global, act local
